Reviews.Title: Buy this TV
Reviews.Author: trem0r
Reviews.Content: My wife and I bought this TV over the Thanksgiving holiday, so we've had it set up for a couple of weeks now.  Price at purchase was ~$450.  This is my main living room TV and my goal was to find a product under $500 in the 42-46" range.  Never realized I could get such a nice display at 48" for this price.  Based on other reviews and research, I figured that the TV would be 'good'.  I had no idea that it would be GREAT.  We took a shot in the dark on TCL, not having been able to see it in person before the purchase.. The free 2 year warranty sealed the deal.Aesthetics:Excellent!  The bezel on this tv is ultra thin - much thinner than comparable models of the same size.  When the TV is on, I hardly notice that there is even a frame around the screen.  It's a really nice touch, especially when you compare it to a Vizio with their gigantic angular bezel.  It comes with a heavy glass base (which was unexpected) and makes the TV very sturdy standing.  Even LG and other more popular brands in this price range have flimsy plastic stands.  Nice touch, TCL.  The remote that comes with it is average..nothing special, but not lacking.Settings/Options:This TV is not internet/app capable which is exactly what I wanted.  I have it hooked up to a HTPC which does all of the streaming/recording that I need it to.  Personally, I feel like internet capable TVs are overrated. Most of them are more pricey than they're worth, especially if you can set up a nice HTPC to do those types of things for you.  With that said, the picture options are basic (color, tint, brightness, contrast, backlight, sharpness, etc) but I found them to be more than adequate to get the look I wanted.  I'm also impressed at how bright this TV can get - it can get much brighter than some of the other models that I compared it with, so bright I actually had to dim it considerably.Inputs:There aren't a whole lot of inputs on this TV, but as an average TV user, I don't really need them.  If you're going to hook up more than a couple of HDMI devices, I'd suggest getting an HDMI switch.  For me, 2 is enough since everything is routed via the HTPC.Sound:Some of the other reviewers here have stated that the sound quality is less than expected, and I agree.  I do not have my TV hooked up to any kind of sound system, surround or otherwise, and I found the sound to be slightly lacking.  It has plenty of volume and I usually have it at around level 20 out of 100 in normal situations, but it does sound a little hollow and without much bass.  There are various sound presets, and after some tweaking, I managed to find a sweet spot that is acceptable to me.  After listening to it for 15 minutes or so, I got completely used to it.  If you're an audiophile, you might want to consider a sound bar or some alternative speaker set up.Video/Picture:I am extraordinarily impressed with the picture quality that is coming out of this $450 TV.  I dare say that it rivals TVs in the ~$800 - $1k price range.  My dad has a 46" Samsung 1080p 120hz LCD, and my wife's grandmother just bought a brand new LG 47" 1080p 120hz.  This display beats the LG hands down in terms of clarity, sharpness, motion blur, contrast, etc.  I would say that this display is on par, and even slightly better than the Samsung in those same categories.  Granted, my dad's Samsung is a couple of years old, but I personally haven't seen a better display under $1k until now (even in store).Black levels are excellent, whites are bright.  Sports are crisp and without blur.  My cable box allows me to switch between 720p and 1080i broadcasts, and I've experimented with both.  Even though 1080i is a better resolution than 720p, the broadcast is interlaced (instead of progressive) and some TV's have a problem deinterlacing a 1080i stream - not this display.  Occasionally, there are some artifacts @ 1080i (not p) but unless you're 'really trying' to scrutinize, it's not worth mentioning.  Of course, blu-ray is 1080p, not i. If you don't know the difference between 1080i, 1080p, and 720p, I'd suggest reading up on those. Television broadcasts are NOT 1080p.  I'm extremely impressed with the deinterlacing processor on this display, and have left my cable box setting @ 1080i simply for the higher resolution.  It might be noteworthy to mention that if you have HD cable service, not all boxes default to 1080i.  Mine, by default, transmitted 720p.  Some of you might not even notice the difference.Other thoughts:- I did a lot of research before I bought this display.  I read all the reviews here on Amazon, and other places.  I also did some corporate research on TCL and found that they have a contract with Samsung, so I believe that the newer TCL models use Samsung screens.  I am not 100% on this, but it makes a lot of sense now that I have the TV - Samsung makes great displays, and I honestly believe that this particular display is on par in terms of quality with Samsung.- Some reviewers mention that the TV packaging was messed up during shipping.  Mine was not.  Nothing wrong with the packaging inside or out.  No scratches or blemishes whatsoever.- If you know what you want going into a purchase like this, I'd highly urge you to give TCL a shot.  Again, only two HDMI inputs, no internet capability.  I gave this TV 5 stars based on video/display quality alone.  All my wife and I really wanted was a tv that LOOKED GOOD to watch.  At ~$500, this is a steal.- Lastly, I'll have you all know that this is one of my very first reviews on *any* product.  I read reviews on products all the time, but never end up contributing.  It took a lot of time for my wife and I to narrow down our selection, especially when you consider that asking for a 42-46" 1080p 120hz for under $500 is VERY hard to come by.  I felt compelled to give this display a darn good review, because I'm darn impressed.  If you choose to drop the coin on this TCL, I hope that you have as good of an experience as I have had.Peace.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful TV with high quality
Reviews.Author: amazonuserx "amazonuserx"
Reviews.Content: I received my TV three days ago. After testing with different video sources, I have to say this is a great purchase!The TV has excellent picture quality, compares well with my 46 inch Sharp. The remote control is easy to use and one can easily adjust color, contrast, etc. I love the appearance of the TV with thin bezel and glass stand, which is stylish, concise but not too bold. It fits well with my classical furniture in the living room.It is not a smart TV, no wireless and internet connection. But this is not a big problem. Since one need to buy a blue-ray player anyways. A $100 blue-ray player usually comes with wireless and pre-configured video-sites and websites. I bought a Sony player and hooked up with this TV perfectly.Overall, I am very very happy with this TV.

Reviews.Title: No 3D, No Wifi, No Internet. Beautiful Image. Love it!
Reviews.Author: J. Sanctus-Filius "Johannes"
Reviews.Content: I just got this TV today a couple of hours ago.First, the obvious.  At this price, it is an amazing deal! I'm glad to have found a TV brand that decided to sell a TV with a great picture and very little else.  I already have an HTPC with blu-ray, wifi SD car reader, etc, and with an HDMI connector.  Why would I want to spend extra money on redundant gizmos on the TV itself?The TV has great aesthetics and looks very elegant with its thin bezel and glass base.  It is no Sony or Samsung ultra thin but it is quite good-looking.Now to the picture and sound.  The usual brightness, contrast, hue saturation adjustments are there but, very thoughtfully, somebody had presets built in such as natural, movies, and others.  That's very convenient.  The same can be said about the sound settings with an equalizer and presets for movies, regular, music, etc. It's nice to be able to set up the sound quickly if one is not watching a movie with the external sound system.  I had no problems with the quality of the built in speakers.I hooked up my antenna (I don't pay cable since I have my HTPC streaming lots of stuff) and the HD programming looked fantastic.  I then watched a number of videos stored in my PC; 1920x1080, 1280x720, 720x576 640x480.  Everything looked as good as the source allowed.  The "creation of the world" segment from the "Tree of Life" was as spectacular as it was meant to be.I am very pleased with this TV. The quality is very good, period, but at this price it is remarkable.N.B.As to the packaging, it almost gave me a heart attack! The box is standard box for TV packaging. However when the box was moved before opening it, the sound of broken glass could be heard!  Needless to say that was very disturbing.  As it turned out, the sound was being made by screws and a metal plate packaged loosely inside a plastic bag. Instead of being tightly held by the styrofoam packaging  as with other TVs that I've bought, this bag was just bouncing around in a space inside the box. Nothing was damaged but that noise was heart stopping.

Reviews.Title: Best value.  Don't worry about brand since TCL is a top 3 brand in China
Reviews.Author: Meng Qi
Reviews.Content: Very likely you have never heard of the brand TCL, but actually it is one of the top 2 domestic brands in China （which is where I came from）.Both screen sizes (48 and 55) are the best deals right now.  No bells and whistles, just good picture and solid build.I had a Panasonic LED TV and I suspect that the TCL uses a Panasonic Alpha IPS panel.  The picture quality looks kinda similar and the view angle is very wide.Picture quality, especially color vibrancy, is not as good as mid-range Samsung or Sony, but those cost $1200 or more for a 55 inch model.  Among second- and third-tier LCD manufacturers (Toshiba, Vizio, etc) there is no match.I do not care about smart TV because I hooked my TV to a blur-ray player and my computer.  Or about connectivity.  If you have a receiver or a soundbar with HDMI switching, all you need is to connect the TV to the soundbar/receiver with a single HDMI cable.So, unless you are very picky about picture quality and bells and whistles, I would highly recommend this TCL TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent tv!
Reviews.Author: LoveLife
Reviews.Content: When I bought this tv on amazon, I felt like I was taking a gamble cuz a) it is not a brand name b) the other reviews where others have said theirs was broken.  Well when I received it and hooked it up it was just amazingly perfect picture quality, rivals any tv in the higher price range.  I am VERY pleased with my TCL!

Reviews.Title: What the Heck!
Reviews.Author: Theomar
Reviews.Content: I'm blown away by this TV (and it's price)!  To say the quality is good is an injustice.  The picture is superior.  I don't have surround sound so I can't speak to that.  I have recommended this TV to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: WOW! that's it. WOW.
Reviews.Author: Tim Wachter
Reviews.Content: we've been looking for a 40+" tv for a year. my only prereq's were: full 1080p, at least 120hz, must not cost an entire paycheck, and must knock my socks off. it took me a year of searching before i decided to pull the trigger on something. in short, this tcl 48" wins hands down. now, for the long review...first, the shipping. it took me two tries to get an intact delivery. the first one arrived, in only one day with free prime shipping, but with two giant holes in the side of the box. i pulled the tv out, and it had a big gouge in the screen and the lcd panel was cracked and bleeding out. i refused the delivery and immediately called amazon, and within 10 minutes of phone time, they had processed my replacement order at zero cost to me. the second tv arrived two days later, and in perfect shape. kudos, amazon customer service!now, the tv. i was afraid that a 48" tv would be too big for the space i had made for it on my wall. however, so little real estate is taken up by the thin bezel that the tv's physical dimensions are comparable to an lcd that only has a 46" screen. that little extra wiggle room made all the difference.the only other hdtv we own is a 23" led for the bedroom, and we had an old 32" sd tube tv in the living room before this purchase, so i don't have the ability to compare this tv's picture to some other big screen hd model. having said that, i am absolutely blown away with the viewing experience on this tv! i tweaked the preset controls for a few minutes before queueing up "batman: tdk rises" in 1080p (we simply had to go out and get something stunning for our first viewing experience). this is where that WOW comes into play.i'm no expert on 60/120/240 refresh technical details, but i'm not a novice either, and i do know when i see judder and soap-opera effect. i have to say, i didn't notice either. all the people complaining in the reviews about this tv being 60hz only, they fail to understand that what the tv is telling you on the display is the input stream quality, not the output to the lcd. almost no input signal is going to go higher than 1080p60hz right now. the tv takes care of the rest. and this particular tv takes care of the rest very well. from the high-action scenes to the sweeping slow pans across vast landscapes, my eyes never told my brain anything besides "this is awesome!" nothing about pixels or refresh rates crossed my mind. and that's the point, right?a couple other things. the remote has received a bad rap for some reason. first, have you seen the standard remotes that come with most electronics these days? they're all cheap, plastic, and basic. that's what you get with a free remote nowadays. at least this one takes AAA batteries instead of buttons. the real question is: does it give you access to all the functions in the tv? the answer is yes. if you're concerned about controlling all your devices with one remote, get a harmony.also, the glass base stand. i never used it, as the tv went right onto the wall, but the base appears to be very sturdy. i'm sure it would be more than adequate to hold this relatively light tv securely on a sturdy surface.the ac cord is hard-wired into the tv and cannot be removed, which i was not entirely happy about, but oh well.there's also just a tiny bit of light that leaks out through a bottom vent on the tv and onto the wall behind it. i've only noticed it once, when i had all the lights off in the room with the tv turned on, and only when the giant tv wasn't blowing my mind with stunning video. it's not a bother to me, but it could easily be fixed with a bit of black electrical tape.i already have an older surround sound stereo system that i hooked the tv up to right away, so i can't comment on the sound quality too much. i did test the built-in speakers out to make sure they worked, and they were the typical-sounding flat panel speakers: tinny, thin, and weak. no surprise there.to anyone scared by the brand name on this tv, i can't convince you that your tcl won't fail after a few months. you will have to rely on the reviews of others who have had it longer than myself, and the provided 2-yr warranty. if it does fail, i will update this review accordingly.i bought this tv for $479. i also signed up for the amazon rewards visa, which included a $50 credit. that $50 covered the mounting bracket, low-voltage wall plates for running a/v cables behind the wall, and a recessed wall receptacle to power the tv without showing any cords. i'm tech- and construction-savvy enough to install the whole setup comfortably by myself. in the end, i walked away with a professional-looking install on a tv that looks like it could have cost well over $1000, all for less than 500 bucks.tl;dr-if you're even halfways considering getting this tv, do yourself a favor and just buy it. after a year of searching, i don't think i could have done any better.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV but doesn't work! Repacement is great!
Reviews.Author: me
Reviews.Content: We ordered this tv and it has a bad screen.  Trying to get TCL to fix it or amazon to replace it right now has been a real pain.Amazon has been great about setting up a replacement order and arranging at the time of delivery of the replacement that they will pick up the original tv and package and return it at no additional cost.  I will update this once again when I get the replacement on its performance. But I can say I will have no problem looking at amazon to make major purchases again in the future as even for big items they have been great to work with when problems arise.Amazon replaced the original tv and pick exit up/processed the return within a week. The replacement TV works great and so far I would recommend this TV...updated my review to 4 stars due too the original defective TV.

Reviews.Title: FFS Green Screen
Reviews.Author: Aoide "-Aoide"
Reviews.Content: We got our Tv in yesterday and set it up. We got a green screen. I looked it up and other people have the same problem with this brand. The ribbon cables in the set are loose. We took the back cover off, hoping we could just secure it a bit. It worked. Picture came up beautifully. It worked this morning just as well. I came home today and turned it on and it was back to green. Needless to say, I'm upset. I dont want to have to take the cover off and hit that cable everyday. My Fiance is reluctant to return it so he may find a better way to secure it.Edit:We are replacing it. When i called tech they said it was probably a bad cable or port. So we will be getting a new one.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: I was a little apprehensive buying this TV since it was not a brand name I recognized. However, after reading some of the other reviews for this TV (the 55 inch), and some of the smaller ones, I decided to give it a try. Thus far, I have not been disappointed. Other reviewers had commented about receiving a broken or damaged unit, but mine arrived in perfect shape. I'm also impressed with the picture, it's as good or slightly better than my other 55 inch Vizio. It was also very easy to mount on the wall. Overall, I'm very pleased.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised!
Reviews.Author: DaveBoughtThis
Reviews.Content: Bought this 48" TCL LED model to replace my 8 year old 46" Samsung DLP model. Searched the internet for days looking for the best deal in this size, and this was it. Was nervous at first since TCL is unfamiliar, but now I'm pleasantly surprised. Only took a few minutes to setup, then re-program my Comcast remote using RCA code 10047. Picture looks great, but the sound was not impressive at first, due to the default presets. So you'll definitely want to navigate to the sound equalizer and customize by boosting the low frequency. So far, I'm very happy with TCL, but will it last 8 years like my Samsung did? We'll see =-)

Reviews.Title: Comcast Code
Reviews.Author: muttyguy
Reviews.Content: I just spent 30 minutes helping my FOB dad figure out how to program his Comcast remote for this TV over the phone. To save you all a headache, the code that finally worked was 0047. That is all.

Reviews.Title: Simple but effective
Reviews.Author: Marcus
Reviews.Content: I bought the 48" TCL after waiting a couple days to find something more compelling. I was a bit wary of the brand, but after reading some reviews, I decided to pull the trigger as the price was simply unbeatable for a new LED panel of this size.I've had the TV for about two weeks and it's been great. Color is good, no dead or stuck pixels, and the bezel is very thin. There is some noticeable flashlighting on the display with solid, dark backgrounds, but I have yet to find an LED TV under 2 grand that doesn't have the same problem. It keeps up with the puck in hockey, probably the most difficult sport for most TVs with its heavy contrast and high speed, and the sound has been good enough to keep me from needing to buy speakers.

Reviews.Title: You'll be pleasantly surprised.....
Reviews.Author: jason Appleby
Reviews.Content: I saw the 48" model at Sam's Club on Sunday. It was next to a Samsung 6100 series. I could tell the Samsung at a slightly better picture (more natural, but knowing have TV mfgr's set their TV's for display can account for a difference). I next headed to Best Buy where they do not carry TCL. They had a 47" LG LED-LCD on sale for $599. I was itching to buy SOMETHING, so I did. I thought it had a sharp picture and a thin bezel and panel. Took it home and felt it was just too small. It didn't fit the spot left by my 50" Samsung Plasma. So I went online and started looking for Cyber Monday Deals, saw this beauty on Amazon. Being impressed from the smaller model at Samsung, I figure with free shipping no tax, the barely higher price was a steal for a 55". Received the TV yesterday, and let me say, BUY THIS TV. I set it up next to my LG to compare, my friend came over to check it out, we played with settings and both agreed it had deeper blacks, brighter whites, and a sharper image. The refresh rate is great, not quite on par with the Samsung 6100 series but for HALF the price, how can you compare? Then comes looks, I was concerned it might not be as visually pleasing as the LG or Samsung when turned off. Well rest assured it's a beauty. The bezel is as thin as my pinky and slightly THINNER than the LG. The TV is slightly thicker than the LG, but that is expected when its a BACKLIT-LED LCD vs an EDGE-LIT-LED-LCD. It is still very thin, but the better blacks and whites from back-lit is totally worth the thickness. The remote is cheap, but so are all TV remotes, unless you buy a smart TV. If you want a great picture and no frills, this is the absolute best option out there for a 55". Only issue I have is no optical audio out. $15 converter will fix that. Assuming the TV lasts (although 2 yr warranty is nice) I could not be happier!

Reviews.Title: Great Inexpensive HDTV
Reviews.Author: S. Alexander
Reviews.Content: Even though I am a techy person, I waited a long time before getting my first HDTV and this one was it. First and foremost, the price is excellent. I bought it before Black Friday because I was okay with paying a little more to not deal with the Black Friday hassle. Turns out that I still haven't seen an equivalent quality, specs, and size TV sell for less yet. You just aren't going to get much of a better TV for this price.The TV itself is great. It has a nice slim bezel, fantastic picture, and easy to use controls. A lot of the reviews say the sound isn't great but I think it is pretty decent. Certainly not a surround sound system, but its better than my old TV and projects it quite well. It has a good selection of connections. There are only 2 HDMI ports, it could probably use 1 more but still acceptable. We have been watching TV, sports, movies, and kids shows on it for about a week and we have no complaints about the TV at all. We love it! I can't confirm but some things I read on the internet says that TCL actually uses Samsung panels in their sets. If so, you are getting good equipment.This isn't about the TV, but the delivery service. This is advertized by Amazon as having the special delivery service where they come in and setup the TV. Not sure what happened there, but I didn't get that service. I got quite the opposite actually. They left a $500 TV right on my front doorstep! Fortunately it was still there when we got home. I selected the free shipping option so maybe that is why. But I didn't see anything to say I wouldn't get that service if I did select it.Also, if you have Verizon's FIOS service you may have some issues with the FIOS universal remote. It does work, but the range seems very limited. Again this isn't the TV since the remote the TV comes with works just fine from any distance and any angle. I might just need a new Verizon remote, still working that.Bottom line, I highly recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Buy this TV!
Reviews.Author: Jungle Ninja
Reviews.Content: All, I was back and forth for 2+ months on whether to purchase a much more expensive TV or buy this one.  Let me tell you, this price point for what you get is beyond incredible and I am very happy that I didn't spend $1,500+ on another set.  I am more than thrilled with the picture, watching sports, etc.  The design is also slick and the minimal bezel makes this TV look like it was purchased for $1700+.  Am I saying there isn't a better TV out there, no.  Am I saying the value here is the best on the market, yes.  Do yourself a favor and pick up this TV.  -Jungle Ninja

Reviews.Title: Great Price for this TV
Reviews.Author: ryan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a basic TV with no extra features. no wifi, no apps, no 3D just a basic TV with a good picture quality at an affordable price. This is that TV. If you are realistic and do not expect it to look like a High end Samsung LED or Panasonic Plasma you will be very happy. It is a really good TV for $500. Don't expect to get a BMW for the price of a Toyota.TCL: I had never heard of this brand before i seen this TV. I Did the research and found its a top brand in China making its way into the US. TCL sells most of their products in north america under the RCA brand. Samsung had outsourced some of the assembly of their LCDs to TCL in 2008.The TV itself is nice to look at. It has a thin bezel and nice glass base. The base seems nice and sturdy. The remote is basic but works fine. I don't know why people complain so much about the remote. Its basic like the TV and it works fine.PORTS: It only has 2 HDMI but remember this is a $500 TV don't expect it to have a bunch. It does NOT have optical audio ports but the Digital Audio Coax works great and produces good sound quality in my opinion. (Personally i thought it was broken until i remembered that i had to enable the digital coax on my receiver. After i remembered and changed the setting on my receiver it worked great.)Sound: Honestly it sounds like any other HDTV. Its not horrible and it's not great. If you want great then get a sound bar or surround sound and use the Digital coax.Settings: I think it has plenty of settings that you can adjust and play with to get the picture to look just how you like it.Now for picture quality. I have not completed the calibration of the TV yet but it looks pretty good. I think it will look much better after its calibrated. But the colors are bright, whites look good, and the blacks are good and black. I looked at a lot of TVs and none in the $400 to $700 range look as good as this TCL. A few have mentioned that they felt it was not a 240Hz TV because the input said 60Hz. Those reviewers simply don't understand what 240Hz is. The inputs are 60Hz just like all the other HDTVs. The TV converts it to 240Hz. Do some research if you want to know more. I personally do not notice any soap-opera effect or blur that other TVs have. I am sure some videophiles would say it looks horrible but for the average person it looks great.Conclusion. It is a really great deal. The TV looks very good for $500. If you want amazing picture quality and have Thousands to spend then go buy a Panasonic plasma or Samsung LED. If you want a TV that looks good and have a limited budget then buy this.

Reviews.Title: tlc lcd led 48"
Reviews.Author: Jim "jbd441"
Reviews.Content: This is my second LED TV purchase and I can't say enough about the great customer service that Amazon.com provides. Having said that I purchased this TCL 48" LED approximately 3 months ago and so far it has been a great buy. The picture is amazing, 240HZ has a noticible difference in action scenes than my 42" LG LED with 120hz. Some people state they don't notice the difference but I do.In short, a fantastic deal for the money, money well spent. Also included is a 2 year warranty which is an added bonus.I would recommend this TV.

Reviews.Title: Mostly pleased
Reviews.Author: YK
Reviews.Content: I was a bit skeptical buying from a manufacturer I hadn't heard of before but I ended up being very happy with the product. No complaints about the video quality and pleasantly surprised by audio quality given some of the other reviews. The only reason I didn't give the product five stars is because it arrived with one dead green sub-pixel :(. Not enough of a concern to exchange but a disappointment.

Reviews.Title: Picture quality can totally match Samsung's
Reviews.Author: Lenny Pop
Reviews.Content: I got mine from Frys (price matched Amazon) to put it in my room and was surprised that the picture quality can totally match, or perhaps, better than the Samsung from my living room, and the price is just simply AMAZING!!For those who are wondering if the panel is made by Samsung, unfortunately, the answer is no.Here are some quick facts about TCL: (sources are in the comment section)TCL actually uses panels from a company called CSOT (or Huaxing), which is formed by TCL and Century Corp in 2009. Don't get me wrong, CSOT is no joke, at leaset the current largest 4K TV, a 110 incher, is made by them.CSOT is now also supplying 2.55 million panels to Samsung per year. So more and more Samsung TVs will have the same panels as TCL in the future. Which means CSOT makes quality panels if they can walk into Samsung's door.And as to where did TCL get their panels before they switched over to CSOT, maybe from AO (Taiwan), I'm not sure, but it's not from Samsung according to an article (link in comment). What Samsung has outsourced to TCL, was just some productions of Samsung panels because of lower costs. And TCL is NOT allowed to use those panels. Which it make sense, because Samsung would lose sales to TCL, if TCL can sell TVs carrying a Samsung panels for a much lower price.At the end, I'm loving my new TCL, and worth every penny spent!

Reviews.Title: My TV showed up over my lunch hour
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Got a call from the freight company that they were 20 min's away from my house.  So I packed up a bit before lunch and drove home to meet them.  First of all,  Both drivers were very considerate, and being a local company, one of the drivers knew my family.  They opened the box, made sure that the TV was not DOA, and both mentioned that with the 7-9 TV deliveries they make per day this time of year, neither had ever heard of TCL.Once I signed all the papers, they left and I hooked up the HDMI line from my HTPC, and started looking at content that had been recorded, and some additional 720 and 1080 content I had on my machine.It Was Amazing!  At 240Hz, the viberant colors and the smoothness of the blacks were stunning!  Put on a Blu-Ray movie, and again, I was amazed at the fluidity of the picture, and the amazing colors that were presented on this set.Mounting it to our articulating wall mount will be this weekends project, and family movie nights will take on a whole new degree of fun (my wife probably won't even notice)  :)But, bring on the rest of the football season and basketball season!We are officially ready now!Amazing TV, Amazing Price, Amazing Picture!

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV!
Reviews.Author: ITGuy1024
Reviews.Content: This TV is simply amazing! I'll be honest, it felt like a gamble purchasing a brand name I never heard of. I have had the 55" version for a little over a week now and I couldn't be happier! Reading the other reviews really helped sell me on this.Don't let the TCL name fool you, this thing rivals any of the big name brands in the 1000+ price range.Granted it's no smart TV. No internet, wireless, apps, ect. But I knew that when I purchased it and I didn't need those things anyway since I have an HTPC setup.The aesthetics of the TV are great. The super thin bezel is very attractive and the glass stand also looks nice.I still can't get over how GREAT the picture quality is! I am truly blown away. It's hard to believe you can get a picture this good for so little money. I paid $699.00 for the TV but it seems like the price has gone up now.BUY THIS TV YOU WILL NOT BE SORRY.Note to buyers:- You can use RCA codes for your universal remotes- The TV only has SPDIF audio out. So you'll need an adapter to go to RCA or Optical.

Reviews.Title: Not perfect, but a heck of a TV for the price
Reviews.Author: TLuc
Reviews.Content: I spent a very long time debating whether to buy this TV, but in the end, I'm glad I did.  For the price, this TV simply cannot be beat.  I would actually give it 4.5 stars.I was mostly concerned about the lack of brand recognition/reputation and some of the things mentioned in the negative reviews here on Amazon and other sites.  I'm kind of picky when it comes to TVs, and I own 6 other flat screens (combination of LCD, LED and plasma).  My other TVs are Samsungs and Sonys, so it was a real stretch for me to go with a brand I had barely heard of and only seen at a local Sam's Club.But I was looking for a decent-sized TV for an exercise room that would not break the bank.  A major name brand in the 46 to 50 inch size would set me back at least a couple hundred more than this TCL, and some were more than 2 times the price.  I figured I'd give it a shot because the reviews were mostly positive and the more I watched it at Sam's Club, the more I liked it.Let me say that this TV will not look its best out of the box.  I think the fatal mistake most people make when purchasing a new TV is that they assume it's calibrated to their preferences and all they have to do is plug it in and start watching.  Well, that's not the way it works these days.  Anyway, this TV has lots of ways to make it look better and you either have to experiment and kind of know what you're doing (and know what you like in a TV picture), or calibrate using one of the many calibration tools/discs out there.  Once you do get it calibrated to your liking, the picture is very, very good, especially with high quality HD material.Of course, there are some things that I think could be better, but I'm really nitpicking here, especially when this TV runs less than 5 Benjamins.  First, this is not the thinnest or lightest 48" TV I have ever seen.  But the thin bezel really makes it appear sleeker than it really is, especially when it's hung on the wall (no one really notices how thick it is or how much it weighs when it's on the wall).Second, the mounting configuration is VESA 200x200 which is generally reserved for smaller TVs (42" and under).  Although I mounted it using a very good multi-directional OmniMount mount, the 200x200 makes this TV difficult to keep level when you move it around.  Granted, I could have gone with a fixed mount which may have helped, but these days most people are using mounts that move around.  400x400 may be the better VESA pattern for this TV, but again, this is not any kind of dealbreaker (200x200 mounts are cheaper and sleeker looking and most can handle the heft of this TV, keeping it level is the issue, and by level I mean perfectly level, it's not like this thing tilts at 45 degrees or anything).Third, the "240hz" refresh rate is a little deceiving.  I have some 60Hz Sony TVs that have much less motion blur than this TCL.  Don't get turned off by this though.  The motion blur is not that bad, but it is noticeable in fast moving sporting events when compared to other TVs.  If you are going to be watching a lot of hockey or other fast-moving sporting events, you may want to pick a different TV.  For all other content, I think this TV does a fine job.Finally, and I don't think this is that big of a deal, but it only has 2 HDMI inputs.  I hooked mine up to a DirecTV receiver and a wifi enabled Sony Blu-Ray player, which is all I needed for my situation.  If you want to hook up more gear, you will need to either get a decent home theater receiver or an HDMI switcher.My TV did not have any dead pixels or green lines as others have complained of.  I also do not think the speakers in this TV are as bad as some have complained of.  Most flat panel TVs have crappy speakers due to lack of space.  Get a sound bar or hook it up to a home theater if the built-in speakers are a problem for you.  I have some wireless headphones that work well, especially when using the treadmill, so that's an option too.I have not had the unit that long (only a couple weeks) but have watched both SD and HD satellite content as well as Blu-Ray material.  I can honestly say that when you are watching something in HD from a quality source through HDMI, the picture is great.  I have no regrets about purchasing this unit thus far and can only hope it continues to perform the way it has because it's absolutely perfect for what I use it for.  I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: A little dissapointed
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I have had the TV for about two months now and I have to say it leaves a lot to be desired.  I noticed that when there is a "bright" scene and the camera pans quickly you can see triangular patterns behind the screen.  Must be the projectors or something?  Also, it is 240hz so I was expecting that "live tv" look that some of my friends tvs have that are also 240hz...not this one,couldn't tell the difference between refresh rates from this tv and my old Samsung 60hz.  Makes me wonder if it actually is 240hz.On the up side the tv was inexpensive compared to most others so I didn't have to break the bank for it but I will probably look to replace it in a year or so as it just isn't good enough.Also to point out I have Time Warner cable and their remotes would not sync with this tv.  Not sure if other providers will be the same but just keep that in mind too.

Reviews.Title: Great Quality TV (48" Version)
Reviews.Author: Eric
Reviews.Content: The TCL 48" 240hz LED TV is quite the great deal. I, like many others who have reviewed this product, was quite hesitant about the TV's quality simply because TCL is probably the most "off" of the "off-brand" TV's out there. Despite this, this TCL TV is arguably just as good as any brand-name TV of an equivalent type.To give everyone a little context from the TV we replaced, here it is -VIZIO M370NV 37-Inch 1080p LED LCD HDTV with Razor LED Backlighting, BlackIt can be hard to quantify what one person's definition of "amazing picture" is as who knows what they're comparing it too. Our last TV, in essence, was quite good overall. Hopefully that helps.Pros:- TV picture quality is very impressive - Back-light is quite bright, images are impressively sharp due to pixel count, and the colors are even more lush that our last TV.- Very wide viewing angle.- Setup is simple.- Doesn't have any sort of high refresh rate issues like "halo-ing" (the weird pixel blur during fast motion scenes that happen sometimes with non-60hz TV's [and sometimes 60hz TV's])- The TV features a picture "quick switch" feature that allows you to simply hit the button and changes the picture mode from "Sports" to "Natural" or "Game",etc.- Comes with a 2 year warranty.- Menu is better than the one on our old Vizio as it has a few more customization features (nothing huge, though).- Minimal frame around the TV looks quite nice.- TV's overall design is nice looking and simple.- The TV has the ability to swivel the screen if need be (at least ours does).- An insanely low price for the quality.Cons- The first TV that was sent to us had some dead pixels on it. I don't believe, though, that this was related to this TV being from some off-brand name but instead the fact that dead pixels happen on most TV brands because...well...they do. Despite this, TCL and Amazon quickly replaced the TV's (old TV shipped out the next day no cost to us and the replacement came the following day). So this is a kind of bad thing. It sucks to have happen but dead pixels are hardly limited to a certain brand.Notable Things - This is just anything that I don't considered good or bad but someone else may care about.- The menu isn't anything that flashy. It does the job of the menu and nothing more.- The remote feels a little cheap if that's something you care about.- The TV takes a bit longer than our old Vizio to power-on or switch between input devices (9 seconds instead of like 6).- Only 2 HDMI ports (although that's more common now a days anyway...also easily worked around if need be).- If you haven't noticed by now, it doesn't have any 3D or "Smart" TV abilities. However, you probably wouldn't be here if you wanted those things anyway. Our PS3 takes care of the whole "smart TV" aspect and you can always purchase a $50 Smart TV USB device if you really want one and plug it into this TV's USB port (most blu-ray players feature SMART TV-like features as well).Overall, this TV is quite impressive especially considering how cheap it is. Like many of you, I too was hesitant at first when purchasing this TV just due to not knowing the company. While I can't speak for their whole line of products, this 48" TCL LED 240hz TV (and likely it's 55" equivalent) are great quality for the price. If you want a high quality image for a good price and don't care about frivolous things like 3D or Smart capabilities I highly recommend this TV. I know it's kind of scary buying an off brand name, but just a few years ago Vizio was an off-brand too. Worst comes to worst, you don't like it (or get a few dead pixels) all you have to do is send it back (which Amazon makes incredibly easy and quick).

Reviews.Title: Fantasic Deal
Reviews.Author: Old Jedi
Reviews.Content: Hard to believe !! A 48inch 1080p 240HZ LED HDTV..... My Wife and I have enjoyed this unit since it arrived. Very easy to setup and the PICTURE!!!! The price was great and as usual Amazons service was GREAT.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work either time
Reviews.Author: Sarma
Reviews.Content: I ordered this through Amazon. As soon as I turned it on, I noticed a huge line of pixels down the left side and across the bottom, plus a baseball size pixel splotch. I figured it was just a freak manufacturer's defect. Amazon replaced it no questions asked.Second time around I was smarter and made sure I turned it on before the delivery person left. Good thing, because the left side of the screen was significantly darker than the right side. Not as bad as the problem with the first TV, but still unacceptable.Amazon has been great about this so far. I think the problem is with the manufacturer. Never heard of TCL before. I read they do a lot of OEM's for other more well-known brands, so they would be reliable. Plus the longer warranty. Guess I was wrong. From now on, I'm sticking to tried and true brands. This TV is surprisingly light, and the material seems thin. So it doesn't seem surprising that it would break easily.Bottom line: 2 TV's tried. 0 worked. Probably not a coincidence.

Reviews.Title: Very Impressed!
Reviews.Author: John Wheeler
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I was skeptical of the brand name TCL since I had never heard of it.  I mean most of the time if sounds too good to be true it is.  But, after reading the reviews on this site I decided to take the risk and give this set a try.  Out of the box I was slightly concerned because this TV is BRIGHT.  Like it can be retina burning bright.  So I scoured online for some calibration settings and noticed a lot of people recommended turning the backlight way down.  This helped tremendously.  After getting use to it I've found this TV  to be really enjoyable to watch.  I'm very satisfied with the price to performance ratio.  I replaced a 42" LCD I bought about a year ago and the difference is amazing.  I would definatly reccomend this TV to friends and family.  Here are my settings I'm using at the moment:Brightness: 50Contrast: 85Sharpness: 60Backlight: 40Color: 42Light sensor: offDynamic backlight: offNoise reduction: lowTACB: offI also turned overscan off, but I haven't noticed it matter much.  The speakers on this set are actually better than my old LCD, which is nice.I've also seen a lot of reviews about the set displaying 60hz instead of 240hz.  You should know that all major cable providers only broadcast at 60hz.  Anything past that is just the TV sets own technology artifically manipulating the signal.  The only time you will need anything past 60hz is when watching Blue Ray.  Even the Xbox 360 and PS3 max out at 60hz.  Having said that I do watch a lot of soccer and on my old LCD which was 120hz the ball would glitch out quite a bit when moving fast.  I haven't noticed that at all on this set so the 240hz might be worth something.

Reviews.Title: Incredible value for the money
Reviews.Author: Russell
Reviews.Content: Very impressive specs and the image is beautiful.  Lacking in connections and other enhanced functionality such as ethernet, apps, multiple HDMI etc but all of this is handled by my receiver and ROKU box so this is exactly what I was looking for.  Image quality is on par with the big names such as SAMSUNG, LG etc.  If you are looking for a great quality BIG picture this is it.  FYI - the pictures do not show the VESA mounting holes but they are there.  200x200.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Keith Seifert "keith_s"
Reviews.Content: When I put on my Lord of the Rings Blu Ray and watched it on this TV my first reaction was "WOW" - it looked that good.  This TV has an outstanding picture - rich vibrant colors, bright clear images and deep blacks (I suggest you turn on the local dimming feature in the picture menu for the best blacks).  The sound is just OK, not great, but not bad either, it's adequate for normal TV viewing.  All in all I'm very happy with this TV and I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: lasted 3 months...new main board & power board...No luck!
Reviews.Author: Lisa-AZ
Reviews.Content: 3/25/13 Update Tech arrived by 10am this morning (9-11am timeframe). Replaced both the power board and main board. An hour later, still not working.  Called Warranty Co (951-300-0940) as stated on work order. Coco walked him through the same steps he had just done and still not working.  Next step is a) they send a box & shipping label, b) we ship to their factory, c) they repair or replace it, d) they send it back. The estimated time for all the shipping/fixing is not less than a month and no maximum time.I suggested they send us a replacement, we pack this one in that box, they fix it & sell it as re-furbished or they junk it if it is not fixable.  Apparently this cannot be done.I've contacted Amazon again.  At this point, I'm not even sure we want it anymore!  Our tech...I do recommend Service Pro if you are in the metro Phoenix area.2/2012 Loved it....came within time, setup easy.  Less than 3 months, black screen.  Called support & they said the Power board went out....and this was a common issue.  Audrey (nice rep) said they would send a board out & it should arrive within 7-10 days; I was to call back when it arrived to schedule a tech & he would be here within 3 days.  It took over 2 weeks for a new board to arrive.  I actually called the day before the board arrived & was informed that no board had been ordered as there was no tracking number.  Once board arrived, I called immediately to schedule service.  Audrey now stated that the tech would call me the next day to set up an appointment.  It has been 3 days and we have not received a call from the technician as to when we can even schedule an appointment.  We definitely won't recommend TCL products to friends, family or even foes (well, maybe the latter :-) ) .3/11/13 Update:  We've now had a lovely 55" wall hanging that has not worked for 1/4 of the time we've owned it.  The first 3 months I had the exact same 5 star comments as we read about.  Amazing for the price.  I hope with a new power board I will like it again.  We could easily change the power board that arrived 2 weeks ago, but that would void the warranty. It is becoming a possibility as I'm not sure the warranty is worth much anyway.We ordered due to the positive reviews...however I've had better experiences at the dentist than with this warranty issue.  Bummer, I really liked it when it worked!

Reviews.Title: Only worked one time before it broke.
Reviews.Author: Michelle Moore
Reviews.Content: After turning on the TV for the first time this 48" TCL would not turn on again.  I tried the usual fixes of making sure the outlet worked, unplugging the TV for 5 minutes, and attempting to turn it on from both the remote and console.  It never came on again, so I'm sending the TV back to try my luck with another brand.  I gave it 2 stars for the good picture quality and ease of use when I was able to turn it on the first time.  When the TV was on I did notice poor sound quality, so I would have probably bought a sound bar if it would not have broken.  I usually just run the sound through my old TV, and this TV had a  much decreased sound quality compared to my old one.

Reviews.Title: Black Friday rebellion
Reviews.Author: Gary W Anderson
Reviews.Content: I found this TV as a reaction to Sam's Club's and Walmart's Black Friday loss leader TV's that they did not have enough of in stock to begin to meet the demand.  This set was a better product (240hz vs 120hz) with all other specifications matching (1080p, LED). The first set I got had a problem with a shadow on half of the screen, but after talking to an Amazon representative they sent out a replacement.  I love this TV! It is great for fast action and even normal watching.  My son's love it for their PS3.  This is not a major brand name, but my research showed that they made RCA at one time.  Not only was the price better than the competition, but no tax or shipping made it even a better deal.  Above all, dealing with Amazon to get a replacement was easy and the representatives I talked to were fantastic.  I highly recommend this TV!

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Suprised
Reviews.Author: jh584
Reviews.Content: I ordered this TV knowing that I'm not a super picky videophile, and that as long as the TV performed its advertised functions I'd be satisfied and carry on. Well, I don't feel merely satisfied... I CANT BELIEVE HOW AWESOME THIS SET LOOKS. Both the picture, and the bezel. It took a bit of time, maybe an hour or so, of tweaking with my DirecTV box and my HTPC resulting in this being as good of a picture as I've seen on any set period. When the screen is blank, you notice some bright spots but who the hell is looking at a blank screen anyway?Use RCA codes when setting up your universal remote.The menu is a little thin in options, but gets the job done as far as I'm concerned.I learned today that TV's aren't coming with RCA out anymore for home speakers, so you may want a adapter cable to use the 3.5mm audio out jack. I just had my wife pick up one at RatShack for a few bucks.This is an upgrade for me from a 6 year old 42" Westinghouse LCD.The delivery guys were great, I felt like a dirt bag for not having any cash to tip them. Sorry guys.

Reviews.Title: Don't believe the negative reviews!
Reviews.Author: John Schultz
Reviews.Content: Prior to making this purchase, I read EVERY review on Amazon about this tv. The reviews were mixed about 60% negative and 40% positive. Many of the reviewers claimed that their sets arrived damaged or that they had a green screen. Many had not heard of TCL and were reluctant to purchase an off brand name. After spending many sleekness nights trying to decide if I should get this tv verses a known name brand set for more money, I went with TCL. After owning the tv for over a week now I have the following to say:The tv arrived safely with no damage. The delivery service was scheduled to deliver between 8am and 12pm and unfortunately we were the last stop. It was Amazon white glove delivery service which means that they carried it into the house, unpacked it, put The base on it, plugged it in to verify it had power, and offered to take away the trash. All I had to do was plug in my HDMI cables and adjust the picture settings!The glass base for this tv is very attractive and looks very high end.Sure the speakers sound a bit "tinny" but I just connected my home theatre system using the headphone out jack on the back of the tv and now the sound is awesome! I read about other users having to buy digital out converter boxes to connect their audio systems, but I simply worked around it using the headphone jack instead.Some complained that the tv has no wifi capability, or 3D, or  Internet apps. So what! I have Directv which has Internet capability and apps. I can also stream movies from my computer to the tv through the Directv receiver. Problem solved.No lag switching channels, the tv takes about 3 or 4 seconds to come on.Also, TCL stands for "The Creative Life". They are one of the top tv manufacturers in China and own about 70% of the market share in China. They recently opened an office in the US and are working hard to get their name out there.Blu-Ray movies look absolutely stunning. I found myself watching older movies I had seen before all over again because I could now notice details that were never visible before. I haven't had any issues with clouding and the black levels look good to me.Bottom line is this - don't believe all the negative hype posted here about this tv. I was so paranoid after ordering the tv on amazon that I lost sleep over it until it arrived. I could not be happier with this purchase. Also the price was just right for me. Only having two HDMI ports might be an issue, but if and when I ever get an Xbox I'll just unplug the Blu-Ray and use that port. Or I can buy a hub to add another port.

Reviews.Title: 48" TCL - Excellent TV for the price, display and size
Reviews.Author: Capt08
Reviews.Content: I've been looking to purchase a standard flat screen TV that didn't have any of the added bonuses that sets come with nowadays (Wi-Fi, 3D, Apps, etc...) since I get some of those features already on my PS3.  Most importantly I also didn't want to spend a fortune on one.  I could not find one anywhere until I stumbled upon this 48" set on Amazon after almost purchasing a 3D LCD 42" Panasonic set with 4 pairs of 3D glasses on Amazon at a reasonable price of $699.  After comparing the pros and cons of both sets to my personal preference I decided to go for the TCL due to the obvious low price, the 2 yr warranty, the extra inches on the screen and the good reviews on Amazon.  I had a bad past experience purchasing a TV set on Amazon whereas the Samsung LED TV at the time (2008) had dead pixels.  Amazon gave me no hassle returning it since it was well within the 30 day period.  I steered clear of LED's ever since and knew that dead pixels was a common issue.  I then purchased a Samsung 40" LCD on amazon as well which then failed on me after 4 years.  Now in 2013, I decided to give LED's another shot since technology is always advancing in this competitive market.This TCL set was exactly what I needed and wanted.  It is a much better fit for me than the Samsung I had since I never needed or used the Wi-Fi on the set to connect to the internet or used all 4 HDMI ports.  The sound on the Samsung was ok but needed bass as all flat screen TV's do including this TCL.  I paid a bundle for a brand name and bonuses I never used.  The Samsung LCD did have good display qualities and the soap opera effect was a plus for me but this TCL vibrancy, color saturation and clarity was definitely a step up.  My TCL claims it has a refresh rate of 240hz but from what I've seen on the Samsung this is not the case on this set.  There is absolutely no soap opera effect whatsoever which like others mentioned, leaves the 240hz to be questioned.  It's most likely 60 hz which is why I gave it 4 stars.  Knowing that, I still very much enjoy this set.  I checked TCL's website on this TV and the specs never mention its refresh rate.  There's actually 2 sets with similar model numbers on their website.  The other set is LE48FHDF3300Z which is missing the "TA" at the end of this set.  Maybe that model has the 240 refresh rate???  I sent them an email to clarify the differences of both models.As others have listed on their reviews of the cons on this set, it only has 2 HDMI ports, the power cord is not removable, the placement of the coaxial port is cumbersome and again the non-existence of the 240hz refresh rate.  I had to bend the rubber casing on my coaxial cable in order to screw it into the port .  The 2 HDMI ports were sufficient for me.  I added pictures of all the ports on Amazon.  My set came with an oily substance smeared on the glass stand and the panel had a fine scuff mark on the top left corner of the screen which was easily removed.  No real damage was done.  The box arrived slightly beaten during shipping but with all of those minor issues the set made it to my home in one piece and it's working as it should.  The glass stand was easily attached and it came with extra bolts to attach it to a wall mount if needed.  Again, my only con is the missing 240hz to create that "Soap Opera effect" that everyone seems to hate.  I really enjoyed that on the Samsung.Since my new screen is larger I made sure to sit at least 8 - 10 feet away from the screen.  After tweaking to my liking the images look outstanding.  The image on screen is the same in any angle I sit in the room.  No loss of color or brightness.  The colors are more vibrant, blacks are very dark compared to my old Samsung and the texts are smooth only if you're not sitting 3 feet in front of the screen and are watching digital channels.  The screen texture is of a semi-matte finish so it is not as reflective as glass.  My settings are listed at the bottom of this review in case anyone wants to try them out.  Please keep in mind these setting are to my liking so do not expect to be just as happy as I am with them.  I am not a professional but thought I'd share them since I was looking for other settings on Amazon myself.  They are set for a medium sized room (10 feet by 20 feet) with very little light from the outside entering the room.  I have not noticed any lag or judder on this set as of yet and I also did not notice any backlight bleeding or halo effects on this back-lit LED after I adjusted my settings.  I'm a perfectionist so I looked for those negatives especially after reading a good amount of bad reviews on here.  I only noticed blurry and choppy video on lower resolution channels which will happen on any set.  While watching digital channels at 1080i (ESPN) and watching Blu-Ray movies (Snow White and the Huntsman) at 1080p on my PS3 I have to say this set is by far the best I've seen even at my local retailers.  I did a lot of research and traveling to stores comparing specs on different brands and models along with the price tags and this set blew those large brand names away especially on the price.  At the ridiculous low price I paid of $469 for this 48" set along with free shipping, backed by Amazon and the 2 yr limited warranty by TCL I could not resist this opportunity.  I ordered this set at 11am on a Thursday and received it at 3pm on Friday using the "Super Free Shipping" option.  I got it in a little over a day and I'm not even a Prime member.  I was mentally prepared for the worst when it arrived and none of my fears came true.  So far, I'm very pleased with my purchase and I recommend this set to anyone not wanting to spend a fortune, not looking for a smart TV and do not care for a refresh rate higher than 60hz.  If anything happens in the future with my set I will update my review.My settings are set under "Personal":Brightness - 48Contrast - 70Sharpness- 60Backlight - 55Color - 58Tint - 0Color Temp - 1Light Sensor, Dynamic Backlight and SABC are set to - Off.Noise Reduction - LowKeep in mind that once you're done entering your settings you must press "Clear" to save them.  Do not press "Go Back" as that will not save the settings.Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING TV for the $$$
Reviews.Author: Sooby Dooby "This Guy"
Reviews.Content: There is nothing out there that is going to compare to this tv for the price.  I use it as a second monitor/bedroom tv and it more than suites my needs.  It is hooked to my computer via hdmi, so it is basically a smart(er) tv.  The audio is transmitted via the hdmi as well, so there aren't a bunch of cables running all over the place.  I haven't listened to the built in speakers other than to test that they worked when it arrived, it is not as full of a sound as my 50" Hitachi but plenty enough for a medium size room, however...  The whole setup is hooked up to a home stereo so I have a full home theater setup in my room (a little excessive for the size of the room but I really like a full experience when I watch movies.)  Watching Hulu/Netflix/Youtube in 1080 etc you would never know you weren't watching a DVD.I cannot comment on what others have said about it not looking like a true 240hz system, as my other tv is only 60hz, but I know it far out performs that unit as far as action sequences/gaming is concerned.As far as using it for a second monitor; I'm an amateur photographer, and 18mp raw/jpegs look amazingly clear and are much easier to edit with this large of a screen.  The only draw back I see there is everything seems a bit too sharp compared to my computer monitor (toshiba lcd) so I pick a happy medium between the two.The only possible con to this tv would be it only has 2 HDMI inputs.  In order to have HD for all my inputs I either have to swap out the XBox for the cable tv or leave the Xbox plugged in the AV inputs @ 480p (which is what I do usually).  I am sure there is a splitter out there that I could buy, but it isn't enough of an issue for me to look into it.Also, with a great energy star rating due to it being LED this thing barely uses any juice and produces veeerrrry little heat, which for a small room is a plus (the computer-stereo combo actually make a difference in my A/C usage in the summer)The styling is modern and the frame is slender and clean in a glossy black.  The TCL logo is very subtle, which is nice for those of us that might care about blatantly advertising their Western Familyesc HDTV.  The black GLASS base is very nice looking, a clean finish to a stylish unit.  I don't like the power light.  It's orange. That's all I'm gonna say about it.Cliff Notes:TCL 48" 240hz LED = great bang for the buckOwned Unit: 1 monthTech level: I do my research before I buy my toysWould I recommend this unit? My 5 star rating says YES!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: MoNavyMom
Reviews.Content: This television is amazing!  The color is so vivid.  The sound is crisp and we are not experiencing the volume fluctuations as we have on our other TV's.  At first we didn't consider a TCL TV since we were unfamiliar with the brand.  After researching TCL, we decided to give it a try and we are so glad we did.

Reviews.Title: Not sure at first...but then...WOW!
Reviews.Author: Lori L Eshelman
Reviews.Content: First let me say after atleast 20 hours of research and comparisons I was ready to buy this 48" TCL from Amazon, then a local department store put it on sale for a few dollars less net. But I want to share my review. We've had the TV for 2 weeks now. The carton and contents were in good shape, no damage. Set up was easy with the exception of the screws securing the screen to the stand were very tight. I was afraid something would snap but nothing did. Programming set up was also easy and quick. There were no fixed or dead pixels. Backlight was smooth and even.So far so good. The picture quality was less than hoped for however. I upgraded my 32" Samsung to this TCL. After 10 days we were ready to box it up and return it. BUT THEN I upgraded to the HD cable box from Comcast and BAM! The picture is amazing, even on non-HD channels. But the HD is fantastic. (I hadn't gone full HD in the past because the 32" hadn't shown the signal limitations). Should I have known better, perhaps. But you don't know what you don't know. The color is great. The preset color options are convenient. The sound is better than average. If you want and expect home theater sound get a home theater hook-up. The sound is strong and clear and also has convenient presets. 2 HDMI inputs are enough for me, cable and Blu-Ray. The thin bezel is modern and  attractive. The stand is glass and adds the overall quality feel.I had to use RCA code 10047 to program my Comcast remote but I saw that tip in a review so that was no problem. I was afraid of the unknown TCL brand but don't be. TCL is the 5th largest TV maker in the world and the #2 brand in China, they have been positioning themselves to breakout and compete with the larger manufacturers. Google TCL and do some reading. I would recommend this TV to anyone. We are very happy with the purchase. Did I mention the price was great? If you want to spend $500 more for a TV go ahead. But unless you need a smart or 3D TV, or just have too much money don't bother.Frankly I don't know why I don't give this 5 stars.Recap: great TV, convenient features, good price. Good buy - very happy!

Reviews.Title: Great value and quality for 55 inch LED-LCD TV
Reviews.Author: P. Larson
Reviews.Content: Upgraded from a 42inch Toshiba 1080p LCD. Like many, was nervous as I had never heard of TCL. But I did about 2 weeks of research, and decided that the $699 price tag for the 55inch was unbeatable. And it was. Received the TV 2 days after I ordered it and I couldn't be happier.  55in is huge, and the bezel makes it look even bigger.  Just played a bluray last night and it was impeccable. Speakers are obviously a challenge on any flat screen, and I had to adjust the treble down some in order to get rid of tinniness, but now it sounds just fine.  The picture is just what you would expect from any flat screen, and has plenty of adjustments to make it perfect for your taste.  Maybe it looks a little off sometimes, but I also think that being 55inches, it is easier to pick up imperfections from live broadcasts and other broadcasts over cable. Like I said, bluray and video games looks perfect. Sports look great, too.  If i had paid $1,000 or $1,200 for a name-brand TV, I'd probably be saying 4 stars, but because I paid 700 for this much TV and I've had it now for a week, I can tell you it's definitely a 5 star.  (Don't let the perfectionist reviewers on this site get you down--they should shell out $2,000 for an overpriced Sony so someone actually feels bad for them on their overly critical complaints.)

Reviews.Title: Great TV w/o the Bells and Whistles
Reviews.Author: Mr.Tooty
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a new TV for my living room, and I could not justify spending &1500+ on a 55 inch TV. I have an XBOX and a Blu Ray Player that takes care of the internet for my TV and essentially makes it a SMART TV :).The picture quality is awesome! IMO, It looks better then my year old Samsung which I replaced it with. There is no ghosting which means the Tiger Direct claim of 12ms is BS!As for sound, it sounds like a TV. Nothing special.Delivery from Amazon was awesome! Two guys came at 3:15 (3-6 time frame was given) and un-boxed it, then made sure it worked before they left. They even took the empty box with them!The only complaint I have, is with my Charter Remote. I was able do a code search to find a code. It works great, but it seems as though you have to point the remote at the bottom left corner for it to work 100% of the time. I bet if I had a Harmony remote it would not be an issue.Long story short, if you don't want to break the bank and you don't care about SMART TV Features, this TV if for you!Helpful Hint!*I know a lot of remotes don't have the TLC Codes listed. The best way to get your remote to work is to use the code search feature for your remote. I have a friend that has the 42 inch version and a Samsung Code worked for him. I've also heard of Panasonic and RCA codes working so give those a shot.*

Reviews.Title: Great TV for a great price
Reviews.Author: Mama in MA
Reviews.Content: Got this TV delivered about a week ago - replacing a 5 year old 42" samsung LCD (great TV, still works, moving downstairs for the kids to use with their PS3).  So pictures is great, there's lots of ways to adjust picture to your preference.  Had to fix settings on HD box to make sure it was picking up full HD (I like that the screen tells you the resolution on each channel so I was noticing low resolution..makes me wonder if my Samsung wasn't picking up full resolution either since it's the same box).  I have had no issues, seems great.  the only downside is I'm still unable to find a code for my comcast universal remote (googled it multiple times and tried multiple codes) so we have to use 2 remotes but that's not the end of the world. I was nervous about not being a well known name but my Mom bought an TCL 40" from Amazon last year and has no issues so far.  White glove delivery too which was great.  Can't beat the price so I took a chance

Reviews.Title: Deceptive specs. but beautiful screen.
Reviews.Author: tawdra
Reviews.Content: I'd been hesitant to buy an off brand television, but the price on this TV was unbeatable. I was extremely hesitant in buying a 240HZ television, as it tends to give non-sports programming a "handycam" feel.Thoughts so far:Pros:--The picture is remarkably sharp, and the colors are vibrant and bright. The amount of inputs are refreshing, and rare to find on the more modern digital sets, such as analog audio out. As someone with an older receiver, this was critical. It should be noted that the audio out is a headphone jack (along with several digital audio outs), and not the standard RCA cables, so plan on needing a headphone to rca converter (which I happened to have).--It has awesome features like auto brightness sensing (adjusts to the brightness of the room, though it tends to be on the bright side), and my favorite--VOLUME SMOOTHING! No more loud TV commercials!Cons:--THIS SCREEN IS NOT 240HZ. I'm fine with that, as 240 looks strange--but if that's what you're looking for you'll be disappointed. My excellent video card detects refresh rates of 40, 59, and 60HZ. Sports programming is most definitely received at a standard 60hz.--The contrast ratio is nothing to write home about. There are noticeable light areas in dark scenes where the back-light bleeds through, and although much more slight--dark areas on a white screen. This isn't a deal-breaker, as a less-obsessive person would probably not even notice...but I mention it for the sake of the concerned buyer.-The Coaxial antenna ports are in a terrible spot and prove quite difficult to screw in. Count on some obscenities being shouted at it while you hook the TV up.All in all, the positives definitely outweigh the negatives on this TCL 48in 240hz (hah...) television. Just understand what this TV is, and is not, and you'll be fine. It's an excellent buy, at a good price, and I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Just received my new tv but has to be returned
Reviews.Author: mikebluesprings
Reviews.Content: I first received the wrong tv that had another person's name on it, then when I did receive my tv, it had two large white spots in the middle of the screen.  customer service had me on the phone for over three hours.  Finally, they asked that I take a picture and send to them the white spots and they finally called me back saying to call amazon and ask them to return the tv.  i am scheduled to get the same model next week, so we shall see.

Reviews.Title: If you're in doubt, doubt no more.
Reviews.Author: K.T. May
Reviews.Content: I was researching televisions for MONTHS and could not figure out which one to buy.  My boyfriend is better at this stuff, so after I spent countless hours comparing TVs in Target, Wal-Mart and PC Richards, (and even securing a pre-order for a Coby, [which I quickly cancelled after hearing bad things]), I told him to see what he could find on Amazon.  He found this TV and after sorting out what could be "insider reviews" from genuine ones, we decided that it sounded like a great deal for the money, and though the name is not exactly a household one yet, it was worth a shot, as another buyer said the same thing happened with Vizio a couple of years back.So, we bought it for each other as a joint Christmas gift, figuring what the hey.  If it wasn't as advertised, we'd send it back.  And it had a lot to live up to, considering this was essentially our only gift to each other this year.  It has been over a month now, and we LOVE this television.Pros:- No side glare - you can see the picture well, even if you are sitting on the side of the television.- It is lightweight and super thin, so it is easy to transport.- Very clear picture.- Decent enough sound - you don't really need a sound bar if you don't have one, especially since there are options to change the sound (i.e. "music", "film", "surround sound", etc.)-Provided you are not signed in to a game system (which you can change the video input from your remote), there is a setting where the TV will automatically shut itself off after 10 minutes of lack of use.  This is very helpful if you have a roommate who tends to fall asleep in front of the television.- There are plenty of settings to customize the picture and sound, as well as "label" your game systems with the pre-loaded options so you know which video input to select for your X-Box or PS3 (for example, I have the PS3 set to "Blue Ray", whereas the X-Box is set to "Game").Cons:-It is not a "smart TV", if you are in the market for one of those.  It's a simple design, which was perfect for us.-There are no buttons on the TV itself, so if the remote ever breaks, I have no idea how we are going to turn it on and off, aside from buying a new remote.-There are a shortage of plugs in the back for cables.  For example, I can hook up the cable box, X-Box and PS3, but there is no room now for the sound bar.  Not a huge deal, but I could see where some people might find that to be annoying.This television lived up to all of the positive reviews it received here on Amazon, and I am so thoroughly satisfied that we decided to go with this one that I kept reminding myself to write this review so I could help others who were as in the dark as we were about which TV to buy.  I didn't get the dreaded "green screen" upon turning it on, as some people have experienced, and the packaging didn't overly give it away that it was a TV, (though we got the 48" one, so I'm sure people could figure it out).Bottom line: If you are in as much doubt as we were about which TV to buy, trust us on this one - TCL rocks!

Reviews.Title: Very nice looking TV too bad it had vertical lines through it.
Reviews.Author: Abe from Detroit
Reviews.Content: I received this item and I thought that I wouldn't be one of the unlucky folks and actually get a working set... my set turned on and everything but it had a vertical lines through the right side of the TV. I called to get this replaced but unfortunately I ordered this through amazon warehouse... so the only thing I could get a refund and not a replacement. Buyer beware and lesson learned. When you buy this TV don't expect it to work fully.

Reviews.Title: Popcorn machine!
Reviews.Author: mike pino
Reviews.Content: Like others noted, TV started popping and cracking within a month.  TV picture etc we were really happy with, but the noises were a concern.  TCL customer service (if you want to call it that) simply states that they know there is a thermal expansion/contraction problem but the TV is "fine".  They did not offer to replace the TV even though the noises had been increasing in frequency - they want us to believe that is acceptable.  I am a light sleeper, and sometimes it would crack in the middle of the night and I would wake up!  Not acceptable to me!  So I finally returned to Amazon, thank God Amazon stood up for it.

Reviews.Title: A good TV for the money. See the world like you want it to be with this TV!!!
Reviews.Author: Mark R.
Reviews.Content: I have had this TV for about 3/4 of a year now. The 2yr warranty was a selling point as well. It seems to be what I wanted & more. The refresh rate allows for a clear picture whether watching sports or playing games. The sound didn't sound good from the factory. It requires that you set the internal EQ for it to soung good. Go thru all the settings to get it to sound & look as you would want. There are a lot of them. I had already purchased a sound bar & woofer, after reading of the low quality of the sound. It really wasn't required if you don't need a sound system right away. I did not like the fact that the TV does not have an audio out. So, I plugged a splitter into the headset output in the side of the TV & then I had RCA jacks from that to the soundbar. The Sony w3000 plugs into the back of the soundbar with the included wire. The TV does have a lag time till it comes on after you press the remote power button. Just give it about 3-5 secs.The remote does feel a bit "small" for a loss of a better wordBut, I got used to it. It does side into some stange places though, so try to keep up with it if you can.On top of the lowest price around. Amazon price matched an add online for another $50 refund. It went back into my bank account. Thank you verry much!!! So keep an eye out after you purchase as well. Amazon will do you right. The TV did arrive just about when it was supposed to. Just a few hrs. late. The delivery persons called when they knew that they would not make it on time. Oh well. They set up the TV, so that I could see that it was in good condition & was working & looking as it should. The base of the tv is made of thick glass that looks good & gives the TV a stable base that is safe on an entertainment center if you do not want to put it on the wall.The TV looks good with the thin bezel that surrounds the TV & it has a pretty much non glare screen if you have it close to a window or a light sourse.Would I purchase one like it again... HECK Yeah!!!Happy viewing...& Enjoy

Reviews.Title: Great value TV with perfect dimensions.
Reviews.Author: Jeremy LeBlanc
Reviews.Content: I love the size of the screen for my living room.  Our 47" LCD went flaky and we needed a replacement.  The built-in cabinet in the room has exactly 49.5" horizontal clearance.  Most TV's of this size are 52+" wide.  This one is EXACTLY 49.5" due to its low profile minimal frame and fits like a glove.  I read some reviews that the motion flicker was bad on this set.  I can say, at the proper distance, there's no issue with motion flicker - if you are too close you see the trails and object jump. Remember the rules of Plasma/LED/LCD TVs - size for your room's seating, not your desire for the biggest viewing area.

Reviews.Title: Good at First-6 Months Later- PROBLEMS!!!
Reviews.Author: Pete Zarria
Reviews.Content: Update 8.13.2013The picture developed a Black spot in the upper screen after 6 months. I reported it to TCL on Aug 5th (8 days ago). They had me email them a photo and a copy of my receipt as proof of purchase. Instead of sending out a repairman, they would be sending me a Box (for a 55" TV!!) and prepaid return label. I waited a week. No Box. I called 3 times. Nobody had ANY answers. They are giving me the runaround. What good is a 2 Year warranty if he company behind it DOESN't HONOR IT!!!

Reviews.Title: It is the Best
Reviews.Author: Joanna Prem
Reviews.Content: At first my husband and I were hesitant to buy anything TCL because we were not familiar with the brand., But, we got the best deal on this on Black Friday 2012. Ever since it arrived, we have been super pumped and we simply love it. The clarity is good, the sound is great and we are so glad that we didn't go for a high priced brand name. I would recommend this to anybody.

Reviews.Title: So far so good!
