Reviews.Author: Phil K
Reviews.Content: I own three TCL TV's! Have had no issues. This particular one for almost $450.00 and with the 2 year protection pan that comes with it, it's just a great buy. The TV is sleek in design and the HDTV LED with the 1080p and the 240hz, you just can't get that functionality and features at this price with other brands. Great buy!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture, Great Price
Reviews.Author: MillironC
Reviews.Content: I purchased this TV skeptical that it wouldn't be any good. I was wrong. This TV has an amazing picture (Similar to Samsung) and has a mediocre sound.. but for the price you can't better. I would suggest investing in a home theater system to sub- for sound quality difference... Use the money that you're saving by buying this TV for that. :)

Reviews.Title: You Mean To Tell Me This Isn't A Samsung?
Reviews.Author: jwayne
Reviews.Content: Haha... corny title, I know.So... I was wanting an upgrade from my Philips 47" LCD; I thought it would be a good idea to move it into the bedroom and go for a 55-60' LED TV but I didn't want to drop too much cash.After researching and window shopping for weeks I saw this television on display at a local store and couldn't take my eyes off the screen. It was sitting a few spots down from a Samsung television and I was stunned at how comparable the quality of the two televisions were. Honestly, with a Samsung label slapped on it I would have been fooled. I knew this wasn't just lack of a good eye because to the left and right of the TCL was a Coby and some other brand I don't remember and their pictures were subpar and not worth half of what they were going for.I was still reluctant so I went to Amazon to read the reviews knowing I would find out this thing was a true POS but found the opposite!Needless to say I have been the proud owner of a TCL 55" LED Television for a few months and consider it a smart, educated, perfect buy. I would recommend this television to anyone who wants superb quality without paying an arm and a leg.DID I MENTION I LOVE THIS TV!? lolSo there we have it :)

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Curtis
Reviews.Content: I never write reviews for anything on amazon but I just had to say I have had this tv for about a month now and it has been great.  I was leary of never hearing of TCL before but I can honestly say I would buy another one!  I am thinking of upgrading my other DLP TVs to the 55" TCL in the coming months.  Great TV and great brand!TCL LE55FHDF3300ZTA 55-Inch 1080p 240Hz LED HDTV with 2-Year Limited Warranty (Black)

Reviews.Title: Excellent!!!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: Truly a great deal for a quality flat!  Beautiful picture with impressive sound and true to size...can't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: bookgirl "di:>D)"
Reviews.Content: I spent two years saving money to purchase a TV for my school library in an effort to bring the library up to technological balance with the rest of the campus. After researching "Smart" TV's, and learning that these need vast improvement, I thought it a better gamble to purchase an appleTV box to convert this tv to a smart tv. I searched the internet, newpaper ads and I visited every retailer I could in an effort to find a suitable unit. I do vast amounts of research and I was pleased to learn that the TCL company has been in business for about thirty years and that the set contains some RCA and Samsung parts. I searched the reviews, especially the negative ones, on every set I considered. The reviews on this model were really good and because this TV is so reasonably priced, I was able to buy an ipad2, appleTV, mount and HDMI cables. I chose the scheduled delivery offer, which was free. Two gentlemen delivered the tv to my library, removed it from the box, plugged in and turned it on so that I could inspect the quality while they waited for my approval.I am very happy with this purchase. I am able to give library lessons and instructions, which include, reading stories and visiting internet sites - with entire classes viewing. With our children growing up in this graphic age, I now capture their attention with this beautiful set and it's vibrant picture quality. This set has "WOW" factor.Keep in mind that flat screen tv's do not have the very best sound quality and that you may wish to add a sound bar if you plan on using it as a theater system. The sound is perfectly acceptable, if a tiny bit tinny.Of note, Amazon offers a low-price guarantee. About ten days after I bought this set, it went on sale at $50. less. I emailed Amazon and received and refund within hours.Amazon, You ROCK!

Reviews.Title: Great TV!
Reviews.Author: D. Park
Reviews.Content: You get what you pay for.If you are on the fence on whether or not to get this, I suggest you consider the following factors:Pros:Great Picture QualitySound Quality (Better than most Flat Screen TVs)Low PriceCons:Limited HDMI portsNo Optical AudioTV Base Screws Don't AlignRemote (You'll most likely replace it)If you are on a budget, this is by far one of the better TV's out there. If you are willing to pay more, I suggest you look for a TV with better specs (ports, optical, etc)

Reviews.Title: Outstanding TV
Reviews.Author: Phil.
Reviews.Content: I was really skeptical about purchasing an off brand TV but I read every review by others who purchased this set and thought I'd take the plunge. My original set was delivered on time and after setting it up, I noticed a white spot on the right hand side of the screen. I figured it was a pixel issue (which it was) but gave it a few days to see if maybe it would self correct. Instead, a second white spot appeared in the top right hand corner after a week. I called amazon and they immediately stated that they would be sending me another tv! I told them that I'd thrown away the packaging and they informed me not to worry and that the carrier would wrap it up and swap it out when the replacement was delivered. Hence, the 5 star rating! Excellent service by amazon and, so far, the new tv looks great! An outstanding value for the price and I'm happy with my purchase and service from amazon!!

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Anonymous
Reviews.Content: Great picture detail and color quality is on-par with most TVs.  I have a Sharp 70" in the living room on which the color quality is better merely because it is the only LCD line that actually renders yellow in addition to the red, blue, and green of other LCDs.  This TV has a nice thin bezel to maximize the viewing area to space requirement ratio.The only real complaint I have is that the standby indicator light is a bright orange LED on the bottom right corner of the front of the TV.  I bought this TV for my bedroom and the standby light is a nuisance.Overall I am very pleased considering the price.

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture quality, but when there is movement the screen jutters.
Reviews.Author: Phoinix
Reviews.Content: So I looked at all of the positive review for this TV and thought I'd give this TCL brand a try.I've had the TV for about 2 weeks now. I've watched DVDs/BluRays and played Xbox games (Far Cry 3) via the HDMI connector. I've also watched regular HD Comcast cable via the component video ports.When the content of what I'm watching is relatively still the screen is absolutely gorgeous.  The colors are vivid and the screen has plenty of brightness/contrast.  As many have pointed out number of inputs are limited, but I knew that when I bought the TV and don't really care.  Some are complaining about the sound.  I use a Onkyo receiver with my TV so again I'd don't really care about the sound.  I checked to make sure the speakers were functional for about 5 minutes then hooked up my receiver.My main issue with this TV is that when there is movement on the screen the video has quite a bit of jutter to it/it gets a bit blurry.  I didn't really expect it given that it is marketed as a 240 Hz TV. I've noticed it with HD Comcast cable over component video, DVD and BluRay via HDMI, and Xbox games via HDMI. I saw some reviewers say they thought only the HDMI inputs where rated for 240 Hz, but I'm seeing this issue on all inputs.  My previous and still working TV is a 40 inch LCD Toshiba from 2009 which is 60 Hz and cost only $400.  As far as the juttering effect goes I don't really see much of an improvement.  It actually looks a little worse, probably because the screen is larger. (The TCL TV jutter looks more like a 60Hz TV)I'm a bit torn about this TV at the moment.  If I could figure out a way to adjust the TV to make lessen this jitter I would keep it, but if I can't I might send it back and spend a little more for a better brand.  But for around $500 bucks this TV is potentially a steal.Has anyone else seen this jutter issue?  What settings are everyone using? Hopefully I just have it setup wrong and there is some magical option I haven't found yet that will fix the issue.  I've tried all the different preset modes, I've tried altering the contrast, brightness and sharpness.  Does anyone that has this TV have any ideas? I saw one post in the questions forum talk about a "game mode" but I have yet to find it.  Anyone know if it exists?If I can get this jutter issue resolved I would totally give this TV 5 stars.Hey TCL company I noticed there aren't any firmware upgrade for this product at this time.  Is there anything you guys can go to fix this via firmware?

Reviews.Title: What a beautiful picture!
Reviews.Author: A. Attanasio
Reviews.Content: As almost everyone else, I wasn't familiar with TCL, but after reading the reviews and a  two year warranty included, I decided to give it a try. Wow what a picture  !  It has a number of preset picture modes. along with a "personal" mode that allows you to set your own preferences. I spent 2 days with trial an error settings ,  and set all picture preferences to my "personal mode". Such vibrant colors  and crystal clear picture quality. Delivery with Amazon was fantastic too ! they gave me a date AND a  3 hour window when the set would be delivered. For this price, you can't go wrong. I had also read that TCL and Samsung have a new joint ventured factory that they build their own branded televisions. For those with Cablevision cable you can program the remote using the RCA CODE. 588.Great picture, great price , great warranty -  I wouldn't have any hesitations in recommending this television.

Reviews.Title: Best bang for your buck
Reviews.Author: JH
Reviews.Content: If you've read the other reviews on this tv, I'm about to say more of the same. It's a large, no-frills kind of tv that gives an excellent picture at an unbeatable price. I was leery of purchasing the 55" initially based on the brand name ("who is TCL?"), but I'm glad to say that those fears were very much vanquished when I turned the tv on for the first time. I'm extremely happy with my purchase and would recommend this tv and/or brand to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: Get this TV!
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: This TCL TV is absolutely the best value you can find. I received it a few weeks ago and I am so surprised how great the picture is. Comparable to other TVs that are twice the price. No it is not a smart TV with netflix or apps etc. but I bought an LG smart TV upgrader (a small 4"x 4" black box) that I got on sale for $30 from my local electronics store, if you want smart tv features i would strongly encourage you look into this I saved money and got a bigger TV by doing this becuz if you look at two comparable TVs, where one is a "Smart TV" and the other isnt, it seemed to be about $100-$150 more.No complaints about this TV, a few reviews said that they received their TV and it was damaged or the screen had issues, when my TV was delivered there was actually a sizeable tear in the box but I opened it up and the TV was in perfect condition not a scratch on it

Reviews.Title: You can't beat this tv for the price!
Reviews.Author: Clint R
Reviews.Content: This tv is everything it is advertised to be and more.  I couldn't be happier.  Easy set up, fantastic picture, and pretty good sound.  For the price it simply can't be beat.  It is a no-frills but quality unit.  I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for price
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: The first one had a defect but looked great so I elected for Amazon to replace it which they sent out right away. Really great picture and a simple TV for those who dont want a smart TV and just a basic good TV at a good price.

Reviews.Title: AWSOME
Reviews.Author: J. Chapa
Reviews.Content: TV IS GREAT. GREAT PICTURE FAST REFRESH. BETTER PIC THAN MY BRAVIA. IF YOU ARE ON THE EDGE , BUY IT YOU WONT REGRET. DELIVERD AND SET UP 3 DAYS BEFORE PROMISE DATE.

Reviews.Title: Picture Perfect
Reviews.Author: MrPete
Reviews.Content: I purchased this 48" TV for my dad for Christmas.  I had to set it up with a Logitech harmony programmable remote, so I took it out of the box, set it up, turned it on.  It has a wonderful picture!I was worried that the picture wouldn't be very good since it wasn't a "name brand" like Samsung.  I have a 46" Samsung 120hz smart TV and it is a GREAT picture.At first the TCL didn't seem to have a good pic, especially on channels that weren't 1080.  (I only have over the air antenna, most are 1080i, but some are 720p, some are 480p)  I made some adjustments on the picture settings and == GREAT PICTURE!Side by side the picture is the same as my Samsung - especially on the 1080 channels.  I really couldn't tell any difference on the 720 or 480 channels either.Granted, there are fewer inputs and much fewer setup options.  You can change the picture enough to make it great.  I did have to turn off some of the automatic settings, like ambient light sensor that darkens the tv when the room is darker.Now the sound - - It was amazing for an HDTV!  Don't get me wrong, I have my Samsung tied to my stereo with an optical cable and the TCL sound was nothing like that.  BUT - with nothing but the TV speakers, it was easy to hear at 10 feet away, was clear, and didn't crackle.  I turned it up to about 60 and it was TOO LOUD!  I don't know how height it goes, but at 60 I had no rattling, cracking, buzzing or other over-driving issues with the sound.  Again I was just watching TV not a hi-impact movie so your mileage may vary.  Another note, I did have the TV right next to a wall.  Not mounted on a wall, but setting right next to the wall so that may have an impact on sound reflection from the wall.The USB input - I copied several pictures that were taken with my Droid X2 phone to a USB drive.  They were 8 megapixel pics.  They looked amazing also.  The phone takes 16:9 pics, so they were formatted for the screen correctly.  The pics were crisp and clear and you could see detail easily.  I didn't try lower res pics because I didn't have any handy.So...long story even longer...I tested everything because I didn't want to give my dad an inferior product.  He lives in the country and doesn't have cable or internet so smart tv options weren't needed.  He is able to get over the air HDTV and will use the usb to view pictures.  All of these features were VERY ACCEPTABLE.If you have a blu-ray player to do your "smart tv" functions, then I would not hesitate to purchase this tv!Only gripe - when you plug in the usb stick, it doesn't automatically jump to that input source and pull up the pictures.Instead you have to press the button and choose the source. Then you have to tell it to do pictures or audio before you get the pictures.  Nothing huge, but not as nice as auto detect and start displaying pictures.On the plus side - it is a 48" TV not a 46.  Bigger is always better!  It is also a 240HZ which may be why the picture is so good.I didn't try the PC input or use HDMI from my pc to check the monitor quality, but probably will when it is installed at my dad's.  I'll report on that later.Those of you that didn't buy this model because it wasn't name brand, I feel bad for you now.  Get it while you can at a great price!

Reviews.Title: Need to find their warranty number to call
Reviews.Author: Yang Li
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on 2012 Thanks Giving. Half a year later, the stereo is having trouble, it buzzes when I turn the voice volume over 40, it's very annoying; and when I look at the screen from a 45 degree(or more) angle, three big shadow lines go across it.I changed my rating from 5 star to 1 for the low quality, and might raise up it a bit depends on their warranty service.

Reviews.Title: Half day ownership so far and I love it!
Reviews.Author: Zhihao Tang
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is very impressive, and the TV is so fool proof, set up was too easy and all functions are very accessible.I think the picture quality is not a single bit less than a $1000 Samsung of same size/spec.

Reviews.Title: Great TV..sharp picture..easy setup
Reviews.Author: pingpong
Reviews.Content: Very satifactory TV. Picture is sharp...At first, used stand to check it and then used optional wall mount. Hung nicely on brackets. Generally, it is very good value and performance is equal to the big name brands which cost from $100 to $300 more than this TV.

Reviews.Title: Just a good picture and a thin screen. No buzzwords here.
Reviews.Author: homeschooled
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, and that is all that it is. No True Motion, no 3D, doesn't connect to the internet, and it won't walk your dog for you. The picture looks really good and the television is as adjustable as you would expect given its budget-TV status. There isn't a lot in the way of connectivity options, but it should get the job done.Prime shipping was wonderful and easy. Showed up in two days in perfect condition. Can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: So far, so good.

Reviews.Content: Ordered it and got it in two days.So far, excellent value. Has a good image, easy to set up, thin frame or whatever it's called looks nice. Sound is what you would expect (not the best). If I have any issues with this TV, I will update my review.

Reviews.Title: For those who rated this badly
Reviews.Author: J. Rife "Reviewer"
Reviews.Content: So many factors here. What are you hooked up to? Me Comcast HD , do you know how to use the settings to tweak? how far are you sitting from the tv?This tv provides a picture thats up to par with a $1000 LED tv made by LG, Samsung. It's a very good tv. If you're hooked up to crappy cable or DVD player you might not like what you see , this isn't the Tv's fault it's the users lack of knowledge on tv's.Get yourself some good HD cable service , learn how to tweak the picture settings for optimal display, use high end HDMI cables and this tv is good to go. I got the 55 inch , but the 48 inch right now @ $464 out the door. You'd have to be a real numb nuts not to get up on it for the price.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely amazed by the quality for the price.
Reviews.Author: Robert Joseph. "Old Dad"
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to purchase this TV while it was listed at $429 a few weeks ago and I'm very happy with my decision.  I was taking a risk on the brand name, having never heard of it, but that risk has more than paid off.  The quality of the picture itself is what surprised me the most when finally be able to view it out of the box.  It rivals that of my current Samsung 55" LED TV that was more expensive (a lot more expensive...), but that surprised me less when I did research into the brand to find out that the manufacturer of TCL has apparently manufactured screens for Samsung TV's as well.  Another interesting bit of information was that TCL TVs were, until very recently, branded as RCA TVs, so my worries have been alleviated now that I know the brand is trustworthy in terms of problems arising as the product ages.Setting up the TV took me around 2 minutes; nothing difficult in that regard.  My only (slight) disappointment, though I knew this as I made my purchase, was that it only had 2 HDMI ports.  I have a Computer/STB/Blu-Ray/WiFi Media Player/XBox that  I wanted to connect to this TV, but I think I am going to just pick up an HDMI Switch to be able to accomplish this.  Having said that, I really have no other issues with the product.  The design is great - the TV is not as thin as my Samsung, but I attribute this to the Backlit-LED Technology (or at least that's what I've read), and the bezel is a beauty.  I've yet to purchase a wall mount for it, but it seems to be VESA 200x200 compliant.Now this television is not 3D capable nor does it have built in WiFi or internet capability at all for that matter.  However, given the price I paid for it (and even its current price), the picture quality more than makes up for all of those features.  For this reason I give this TV 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Great TV !!!!
Reviews.Author: Christina Bigelow
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a bedroom TV and the picture is great.  I have a samsung 3D TV in my living room and the picture is just as good as that one that we spent a few thousand dollars on.. I would recommed this TV..

Reviews.Title: Don't buy from TCL
Reviews.Author: Valerie
Reviews.Content: After one year our TV just stopped working. We have a two-year warranty and we aren't getting any help. It has been almost 4 weeks of excuses for not being able to help us fix our TV.  THe best part of this deal is they of waiting for someone in tech support to come back from sick leave and for another person to find our paper work from the files of an employee who quite, we  were  asked to pay $50 to get a box to ship the tv them. Now they don't have a box to send us. Don't expect anything for your warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great Budget LED TV
Reviews.Author: Bryan B
Reviews.Content: If you're in the market for a no frills LED TV, I highly recommend this one. I recently purchased the 48" version of this TV during Amazon's Black Friday deals week for $479 and have not regretted doing so. Of course there are nicer name brand LED TVs out there but for under $500, who could resist this deal??I was wary of buying this set since it is not a major name brand.  Amazon shipped me the TV via FedEx, so being afraid that FedEx was going to leave this at my doorstep, I had requested to pick it up at a FedEx store. The TV was in flawless condition upon opening and everything worked right out of the box.The thin bezel makes the TV look bigger than it actually is which is really nice for this price. The picture is clear and crisp and the colors are vibrant. There are some settings that you can adjust for the picture and it does come with some standard picture settings. I use my Xbox to play games and watch movies on it and the picture looks spectacular. You can also connect a USB flash drive and play mp3s on the TV.What made me buy this TV was that 240hz refresh rate. There isn't a setting you can adjust in the menu for the refresh rate and I think that for the most part, it defaults to 60hz. 60hz is totally fine for everyday watching but I kind of wished there was a setting to adjust it.Like others have said, the sound on this TV is puny like all other thin TVs on the market. I fixed that problem by investing in a 2.1 sound bar.Overall, I love this TV so far. I have it mounted to a TV stand and looks great in my living room. This TV doesn't have any smart apps or wifi but if you have a gaming system, you don't really need that stuff anyways. This TV won't compare to $1k set, but for the price, I'm more than satisfied.Pros:Thin BezelGood picture qualityUSB connectionPriceWarrantyCons:Lack of advance menu settingsSpeakersLack of Digital optical audio connectionOnly 2 HDMI ports

Reviews.Content: got this tv a few weeks ago. the picture is perfect and its really thin. the speakers are weak and the remote sucks. theres also a pesky usb mode that pops up and wont exit without remote when using side controls

Reviews.Title: Awesome picture on a basic no frills TV
Reviews.Author: M. Hull "NoSpam714"
Reviews.Content: I've had this TV for close to a year now, so I feel comfortable giving it an honest review.  This is a great TV for the price.  I was looking for a basic no frills (aka, no smart TV, no 3D), and per the reviews here this TV had a great picture at a good price.I can say without reservation that I totally agree, the picture on regular TV and my ROKU box is very impressive.  The only minor complaint I have about it is also along the lines of what others here have said, the internal speakers are tinny, which was easily solved by plugging in an old boom box with AUX in to the headphone jack from the TV.  The TV remote controls the volume of the headphone jack, so it works out well.Pros:1.  Reasonable boot up time.  About 10 seconds from TCL splash screen to a viewable picture.  A little longer on HDMI.2.  For regular over the air digital TV, reasonable change channel time, about 2 seconds.3.  Great picture on anything that is digital, HDMI or regular over the air TV.4.  Super thin, and easily accessible inputs without having to remove the TV from the wall.5.  Up-convert of regular analog TV results in a better than expected picture.Cons:1.  Tinny sounding internal speakers. (Easily solved via headphone jack)2.  Only two HDMI ports.3.  Thermal expansion noises.  The case makes rather loud cracking like sounds as it heats up and cools off.I ordered this with the Cheetah wall mount B0012S4APK and I am also extremely happy with the wall mounting of this TV, nice and close to the wall, but enough room to get to cables.

Oldy 2 HDMI conections and only SPDIF Audio output. There are no RCA jacks and no Optical audio output. Reviews.Title: None of that smart tv garbage. It works.
Reviews.Author: jesusplay
Reviews.Content: Well It's an LCD tv, LCD tv's suck when it comes to image quality regardless of brand in my opinion. The only way to get the blacks to look black and the picture not looked washed out is by turning the brightness down! I watch movies on zero brightness and they look amazing.back to the tv:I've owned 2 samsungs and 1 sharp.The samsung was a 55' 1600 dollar tv, edge lit, super thin. 2012 model, I will say that compared to that LED tv the TCL isn't as bright on max brightness...This TV is about as bright as a regular LCD-CCFL lit samsung I got about 5 years back.I will say compared to the other 3 LCD tv's I've owned this one has virtually no backlight bleeding or ghosting(even on max brightness).Picture quality is on par with the samsungs I've owned and the samsung and TCL are better than the sharp tv i bought last week, great panel.The TV is as thick as a CCFL LCD tv....about 3 inches thick. The samsung I had last year (edge lit) was like less than an inch thin...But doesn't really matter...Who looks the the tv from the side?The bezel is thin.Took a little more time to adjust the color settings than any other tv I've come around but I got it to display the colors correctly to my eye.They could have made the stand a swivel stand...but whatever.Pretty good tv, screen-wise and the lack of ghosting effect I'd say this TV is on par with the tv's that cost double the price.I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Don't fear the brand, amazing value and image quality
Reviews.Author: Daniel J. Brown
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing TV for the money so I will just make a few important points. The one we bought at a B&M; does not have "TA" at the end of the model name and has a colorful, retail style box compared to, what I heard, a plain box you will receive from here, but same specs.- Don't worry about the brand, it is huge in China but usually is sold in the U.S. under the RCA brand name. Simply use the most common RCA code to program your universal remote for this.- LED BACK lit, not edge. Not quite as thin but WAY better lighting uniformity. Default setting of 80 on the backlight is WAY too bright for home use, be sure to turn down for proper blacks and to avoid cloudiness in dark scenes. Depending on preference try 25-50 with your contrast bumped up to 85-90. This is the ONE thing you should do to get a much better image. Of course personal preference can vary, some prefer super bright even if it creates cloudiness and grey blacks. After having a plasma before this, I have learned to truly appreciate decent black levels.- 240Hz. I truly believe it's there. The Live Video/Soap Opera Effect is usually a result of the way the signal is processed by other brands, yes even good ones. I could be wrong but it appears TCL takes a 60Hz signal and simply quadruples the # of frames internally before displaying the image as is without losing depth of field. I think EVERY 240Hz should be this way and it blows my mind TV's costing double aren't. The biggest example of this is in cable image. I set my cable box for 1920x1080i yet it definitely appears like a very smooth, crisp progressively scanned image. With 60Hz TV's before I would try both 1080i and 720p and not get an image this smooth, so it is definitely doing something and I like it. So yes, use 1080i and not 720p for cable/satellite, it looks much better. I truly believe the 240Hz in fact acts like an upscale feature here.- Very attractive thin and modern looking bezel, this is a pretty big deal in appearance of quality.- Remote is mediocre, but not terrible, especially for the price.- There is a bit more of a delay in switching inputs than other brands. Also have found delays in button response tweaking the sound equalizer. That was annoying.- Image quality is excellent and sound is very mediocre like any LCD. Does not have optical out for receiver, only coax.- Viewing angle does not seem great. I definitely miss that from the plasma we had since I sit off to the side while on my PC.- 2 HDMI's is indeed 1 short of average these days but I think I have found a creative solution. The regular coax/cable input takes the 1080i/720p signal that the cable box provides so I am going to try to hook up my cable using that instead of using up an HDMI I need for my Blu Ray and PC.5 of 5 for the price, 4 out 5 overall with the flaws. Well worth the $499 we paid, if you can find it for less consider it a bonus!

Reviews.Title: Great TV at a great price.  Best deal around for the money!!

Reviews.Content: Easy set up and easy to install the good looking glass base.  Great picture and decent sound for a flat screen, but sounds great with my surround sound system!!  No complaints yet, and would highly recommend this set to anyone looking for a great deal at a great price.

Reviews.Title: 'THE' LED TV On A Budget
Reviews.Author: Canis Majoris
Reviews.Content: At this point in the TV buying process, I can easily surmise that you are looking for an LED that can fool you into thinking it is good quality for a price that does not exceed your `thoughts' for what this type of viewing experience should cost. If it does not sound like you, well it is somebody; it is me.Before moving into a new apartment I wanted a sizeable TV that was thin, and had low maintenance (LED vs Plasma--as much as I prefer, sometimes I do not want to worry about burn-in).Here are the TCL's grades:Quality: 7/10 - The poor black levels do not bother me much for what I was expecting from this set.Colors: 7/10Blacks: 5/10In general, watching anything or playing video games is going to be very enjoyable. Colors are bright--as to be expected from an LED and contrasted/saturated well enough not to be noticeable as `bad quality'. Colors look adequate.However, if you care, or are an aggressive advocate, of black levels, you will not approve.  There is much backlight-bleed i.e. white light from the back `bleeding' through the screen like if someone was holding a flashlight behind a black piece of construction paper. On my set it is to the point of a very washed out black in the corners of the screen. The blacks look like black/white mixed together (again, probably from the excessive bleed). That being said, as much as it might is `supposed' to bother me it does not.Sound: 7.5/10As much as I appreciate crystal clear sound, lossless audio and `full' quality of music--I was not turning up the volume on this expecting surround sound. Furthermore, I did not notice that I was using the TV's speakers because it works perfectly suitable, and gets quite loud, for viewing. Do not expect much but; I was impressed.Appeal: 8.5/10Fairly thin bezel, around 2" thick in the back and it looks great mounted up on a swivel stand (one that can `come out' about 15") on the wall (because this TV is light, it does not pressure the mount at all). I could lift this by myself easily and hold it on the wall while others would judge the proper position on the wall.---Ending Thought---For a TV in your bedroom, kid's room, play-room, living room, or anywhere this is a must for the budget buy. You will be sacrificing a bit if you dig the depths of quality compared to other higher priced set however, after it is turned on you will know the money saved allows you the peace of mind that you made a purchase for exactly what you were looking for - a quality HD LED TV at a good price.

Just know its not a smart TV but you will be smart when you hook up all your smart devices to it and enjoy....Don't forget to watch a hockey game or two so you can appreciate the 240hz refresh speed!!!Kevin,Lino Lakes, MN

Reviews.Author: C. Coles

This TV has an SPDIF connection for audio, which interfaced nicely with my existing sound system.  It almost feels like an upgrade, rather than a "budget replacement."

Reviews.Title: Don't Be Scared By Off-Brand
Reviews.Author: famman84
Reviews.Content: I had never heard of TCL before purchasing this television.  We were looking for a big TV, and didn't want to spend an arm and a leg.  We came across this TCL television on Amazon.  I am usually very against purchasing off-brand electronics, but this one had good reviews, so I decided to gamble on it.  It was worth the gamble.  The picture is great, and the sound is not bad.  The only complaints I have are small ones.  When labeling your inputs - the manufacturer spelt blu-ray as "Blue-ray," which annoys me every time I see it - but it doesn't impact the performance of the TV.  The only other issue, is that since this is an off-brand, it is difficult to program universal remotes to work with it.  Other than that, this is a great TV, and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it to anyone who wants a big TV, but doesn't want to break the bank.

Reviews.Title: I thought this was the best TV purchase I've ever made! **Edit made
Reviews.Author: DrRuthie
Reviews.Content: ***2nd Edit 9/16/13: Received a call within 2 days from the stateside warranty department in California that the TV was not covered due to being purchased from Amazon Warehouse. Spoke to 2 supervisors above the rep I spoke to first. The warranty issue has now been resolved through Amazon, but my issue was that the overseas TCL call center rep revealed this is a common issue with this model television. We never even finished the troubleshooting with the representative before they ordered the new part, which only supports that statement. Very disappointed in TCL's warranty department. The first supervisor in the Warranty department needs a re-training in the area of customer service. Who refuses to give a last name?! Still waiting for a return phone call from the higher supervisor. Because of this, we went to the big box B&M; store and bought a larger TV through them. BEWARE: TCL will not cover known issues under their 2 year warranty if you buy through the Warehouse! I no longer recommend this product due to product failure in 9 months and poor customer service.**Edit: 9/12/13 (9 months into the purchase)- we have to unhook all the connections and once we hooked it all back, the unit wouldn't receive any signal (hdmi, coaxial, etc). Called TCL Cust Service and dealt with an overseas agent. Walked through troubleshooting and then was asked to submit my invoice by email. So why did I register the product?! She mentioned they have no access to that information. Seems like a business process that in the year 2013 is common place. Thankfully I was able to whip out a pdf of my Amazon invoice within 5 minutes, but she never called us back. Husband took care of it the next day. Apparently this is a common issue. They had already ordered the part and shipped it to us. Once we receive it within 6 business days, they'll send a technician out to replace it. Hopefully it all goes as planned. Dropping from 5-4 stars.Original Post: I'm pretty picky when it comes to screens, but this model's screen is just right. Not too white or dark...lines are crisp. Will purchase a TCL again when we're in the market for another.

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: Dennis M. Edwards
Reviews.Content: We just got our TV and set it up and was so glad we bought it. The picture is as good as any I have seen on much more expensive models. I was not sure at first about it being a brand we had not seen before. The cost was also a plus. Could not be happier.

Reviews.Title: Good TV - great value but not without fault
Reviews.Author: D. Eno
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 48" version of this set in early Dec. 2012 and it's had heavy use since. I have it in a side room so not the main TV I watch but the kids use it at all times for TV and gaming. I gave it 3 stars based on what it is (average large flat screen TV) plus 1 for value.Pro's - straight-on viewing is great, thin, doesn't look like a cheap set just sitting there, very low power useCon's - angle viewing quite a bit dimmer, long time to turn on, sound, only 2 HMDI inputsMy other large main sets are plasma, which have the benefit of no change in brightness based on viewing angle but suck down the juice. This set (like most LCD/LED sets) suffers from a darkening of the image at any angle other than straight on. This set suffers from it more than most I think, with the brightness drop-off quite stark, not gradual like some other sets I've seen. In my case the TV is set up on the long wall of a rectangular room which exacerbates the issue, so if it were placed on the short wall of a long room this would be less of an issue. But as I mentioned it's mostly being use by the kids, and they like to pause the DVR for hours at a time which is no issue for this type of TV but isn't great for plasma so for my purposes it's very good.Overall a good set, great price, accurate product info and helpful reviews here, and UPS shipping of the 48" model was flawless. Note that the HDMI inputs are side mount, the other inputs and outputs are down mount (in you are considering wall hanging).

Reviews.Title: They've raised prices, used to be $699
Reviews.Author: Mrtn
Reviews.Content: While it used to be $100 cheaper, I would still recommend this TV.  I've been extremely pleased with the picture.  I currently use it exclusively as a monitor for my computer.  Just a tip: I wouldn't recommend using the HDMI input for a PC, try the dedicated RGB (PC) port instead.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised and relieved
Reviews.Author: William Blakey
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research a year ago and purchased an LG LED TV, now our 32" family room LCD had stopped working.  I again did a lot of research including visits to Best Buy and Costco, as well as Amazon of course.  This TCL caught my eye for its screen size, refresh rate and 1080p resolution, not to mention the 2yr warranty.  The price could not be beat for the specs, so I gave it a shot knowing Amazon's great customer service and return policy (I did also purchase a 4yr Square Trade Warranty just to be safe).  Great picture, looks very clean and stylish.  Watching sports is great, no noticeable distortion, etc.  I do have an external Vizio soundbar which is typically needed with these newer thin LED TVs.  Very happy so far - it's been about two months now.

Reviews.Title: Great value even at a higher price
Reviews.Author: K. E. Chapman
Reviews.Content: Bought this TV last week at eighty bucks higher and was very pleased with that price point. Set the TV up and it looks GREAT, so bright and the viewable angle is ridiculous. Sound definitely doesn't seem like anything special. Went to check the reviews on Amazon after setting it up to see if anyone had any tips, tricks or suggestions for the TV, and saw that the price had dropped, and I called support and got the drop credited back to my account. So happy about that... might just have to use that extra towards purchase of a sound bar.

Reviews.Title: 55 TCL
Reviews.Author: SSJEFF
Reviews.Content: I have had the TCL for about a month. I was planning on getting a more expensive TV but after reading all the reviews I was not impressed with anything. I figured I could get this and a PS3 for the less money than the other brands. I hung it on the wall and mainly use my theater system for sound. I have my xbox, ps3 and computer hooked to it. Picture is great. The settings are very simple which I like. It does not have the soap opera effect or option which I do not like. I plan on getting the 48 or another 55 for my bedroom eventually.I have prime so shipping was free 2 day. It showed up slightly late but I did not mind(1 hour). The people carried it in the house but since it was below 55' they would had to wait to fire it up and test it. I signed the delivery and later took it out of the box with the help of a neighbor. It has worked flawlessly since.Update 28Feb2014One thing to note, I have this tv on a light switch so when not in use I kill the power to t and my whole entertainment system. This saves about $5 a month on the power bill. Every once in a while when I hit the power button the orange light goes off but the TV does not come on. I unplug the TV, wait a few seconds and plug it back in and the orange light comes back on. When I hit the power button this time the TV comes on. This has happened at least 5 times and rebooting the power has worked every time.I still keep it at 5 stars due to the low price I got this thing at and I am happy with the picture. I use this mainly to play Battlefield 4 with my xbox one.

Reviews.Title: Screen Died Quickly, Poor Service, Partially Honored Warranty
Reviews.Author: Rural Life
Reviews.Content: I wrote a positive review after 8 weeks, thinking that would be long enough for any defects to show up. The TV was working perfectly at that point, being watched for multiple hours most every day. This is the largest TV that I've ever owned, and I liked that the picture didn't have any of the grainy-ness some larger sets suffer from. The 240Hz seemed to be doing it's job to prevent blurring when watching sports and other fast moving images. I'm not an audiophile, but the speakers seemed to produce great sound. The controls were easy to use, and the remote made more sense than most. I loved the narrow border around the screen, keeping it from taking up as much space as you'd expect a 55" set to need.Sadly, the picture screen died after less than a year. Worse yet, TCL made us jump through endless hoops before they would even think of honoring the 2 year warranty which was included with this TV. When we finally made our way through all of their silliness, TCL decided they would only offer a partial refund. They wouldn't replace the TV, claiming there was too much risk of damage during shipping. They also wouldn't refund our entire purchase price. My wife finally gave up and agreed to a partial refund (we'd been without our large living room TV for over a month, and kind of wanted the TCL refund money for purchasing another large screen TV). I came away convinced I won't be buying from TCL again in the future. Hopefully anyone who buys from TCL gets a quality product, and never has to deal with TCL customer "service". I feel serviced all right, just not in a good way.

Reviews.Title: Great deal - but so so quality
Reviews.Author: Phillip Trexel
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv for $700 on black friday - it came in the mail 1 1/2 weeks later.  A month later a part went out in the TV and it is no longer working.  We called the company and they sent us the part (telephone customer service was terrible).  We are supposed to call them back so they can send someone out here to fix it.  Great deal but I next time i'm stickin with sony

Reviews.Title: direct tv code is 10047
Reviews.Author: eman "eman"
Reviews.Content: direct tv code is 10047turn tv on / off with remote switch set to tv (all the way to right)turn receiver on / off with remote switch set to direct tv symbol (all the way to left)volume and channel now work from D/T remote set to direct tv symbol on remote

Reviews.Title: For the price, simply can't be beat.
Reviews.Author: jredfearn
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because I was looking for a great deal on a tv with some good specs. Luckily, I found this gem on sale and couldn't be happier.It is pretty thin which is something I dont care about but it is impressive. It has 240 Hz which is very noticeable when watching sports. I think the refresh rate performs even better than some plasma tv's that I have seen.When I'm watch HD content the picture is very clear. It's an LED screen and unlike some other LED tv's that I have seen, the lights are directly behind the screen instead of on the sides which is nice. When a tv uses LED lights on the sides of the screen, the picture is lighter around the edges and darker towards the center, especially at night. Even though the screen is back-lit, it is not entirely uniform. When there is a really dark or light scene in the movie or show that you are watching, you can see some areas of the screen that are more lit than others. It's not really noticeable, but I am very nit-picky. The other 99.9% of the time the screen lighting looks uniform.The sound is more than adequate when it comes to actual volume level. I usually have it around 17 out of 100.The picture settings menu is pretty basic which will be fine for the average user, but if you are like me and want to calibrate your screen, you may feel underwhelmed with the menu.The screen is very bright! I have the brightness set at 47 out of 100 so I dont think you'll have issues there.The two year warranty is awesome and covers both parts and labor.I got this tv for $400 bucks. I lucked out because $400 bucks is at the top of my price range. But if I had $900 to spend, I would get this tv over any other brand that you'll find right now in the 500-900 dollar range. You wont find another tv with this good picture, 240Hz, LED, great sound, two year warranty in that price range. So even at the price it is at right now =$550, it is definitely worth the price and is a bargain.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy, Great Product
Reviews.Author: Randy Polkinghorn
Reviews.Content: only reason it's not 5 is because of the sound. It's just satisfactory. Needs surround Sound or a Sound Bar

Reviews.Title: VERY Happy with TCL
Reviews.Author: sauclair
Reviews.Content: I ordered my TV with some trepidation due to the mixed reviews on the TCL products; however, I have had no problems, and I am really enjoying the sharpness and clarity from my set.

Reviews.Title: Great so far, 2-year warranty doesn't hurt
Reviews.Author: Ryan
Reviews.Content: Great TV so far, the only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because it does take a little while for the TV to start after turning it on. Also the sound on this TV isn't so great, so if you have a little extra cash to spend on a sound bar or surround sound, I would suggest doing so. I will update if I notice anything else.

Reviews.Title: This is my new computer monitor. It is beautiful.
Reviews.Author: Christopher R Wright
Reviews.Content: This is a barebones Samsung LED panel without the BS software. I haven't actually used it as a TV yet, but it is a phenomenal external monitor for my laptop docking station. Wireless keyboard and mouse, and you are in business with whatever 3D modelling application, CAD program, or game.

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer service!
Reviews.Author: Echo
Reviews.Content: For me,customer service is the most important part of purchasing. TCL excellent customer service is not about quick service, but helpful service. When i received the TV and didn't know how to do with it, i contact the customer service. They are so patient and professional.I'm so glad to have it!

Reviews.Title: BEST  TV  I  EVER  HAD
Reviews.Author: Don Kandlbinder
Reviews.Content: I ordered the TCL HDTV on the 3rd of January-2013, received it on the 5th of January-2013.I had read reviews for over a year of comparing and shopping for my new HDTV. This 48 incher is replacing a Vizio 31" which is going to the bedroom. Getting back to the TCL, I can't put enough praise onto it! TCL has made a winner. The packageing was excellent and of heavy stock. The hardest thing was the mount with its four screws, what a pain in the ka-putter.Overall my wife and I are very pleased with our new TCL HDTV.

Reviews.Title: AMAZING TV for an unbeatable price!
Reviews.Author: Stephen W.
Reviews.Content: After researching many different HDTVs and shopping around for the right deal I found this gem. At first I was wary because I did not recognize the name brand but after doing some reading I found that the TCL company has been in existence for many years.I was looking for just an HDTV. I didn't need the 3D, the apps or wifi. This fit my price range perfectly. I have noticed no defects, remote works fine. Everyone that has seen it has complimented it and was amazed at the price.I would easily recommend this TV to anyone and everyone in the market for a simple, no frills HDTV(I have been using this tv for movies, console gaming, streaming videos and also playing games on my PC)

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: MPG
Reviews.Content: Great TV and an excellent picture!!!I would put this TV up against any TV, for the best picture!!Great value.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: James Harper
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing TV for the price. This picture is great and it was very easy to set up. The only dig I would give it is that the audio is not very good, but this was easily remedied with an inexpensive soundbar. I would highly recommend this TV to anyone in the market. You can't beat the price

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great Bargain!
Reviews.Author: draider9
Reviews.Content: This unit is great! I don't know why there are negative reviews on this. Is it absolutely perfect? No. Does it launch rockets and open Stargates? No. So stop whining people. I'm sure there are defects, like with everything else but trust me, for the price the quality is fantastic. If you do get a bad egg there seems to be a pretty decent warranty and if all your problems cant be resolved with the manufacturer you can always give Amazon a call or maybe you should've just bought an additional protection plan. Anyways, I use this as my living room tv and I have everything plugged into it...well, I have a home entertainment receiver to mitigate all the problems with cable management, etc. so it is connected to that but I run everything from the Xbox to my blue ray player on it and the picture is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: Amazing
Reviews.Author: Kat
Reviews.Content: I gave this as a gift and i loved the price, clarity, and everything about it !  My grand daughter has it going almost non stop !  The only thing I would say anything negative about is the false advertising on amazon about having the white glove delivery...never happened..it was delivered like any other item...  But the tv itself is excellent!

Reviews.Title: Tcl 55 in tv
Reviews.Author: Ania j
Reviews.Content: Great tv and a nice size. My boyfriend has completely fallin in love with it! Works great!!! I would recommend this tv to anyone!

Reviews.Title: great product and impressed with amazon
Reviews.Author: Fischer
Reviews.Content: I am very happy with this product. I've never heard of the brand but I see no differences compared to all the  other name brands. I had never ordered anything from amazon and they exceeded my expectations, now I will not order anything online from anyone else.

Reviews.Title: Great Buy for the money
Reviews.Author: Michael Moser "Friar"
Reviews.Content: you won't be disappointed.  Worth every penny of $699 plus tax.  Drawbacks? No audio out, so I could not hook up my bose with either analog or digital! :(  finally put a plug into the headphone jack and routed it that way.  This is a no-frills TV with soft plastic housing but looks great on the wall and looks like you spent a S-load more.  Also don't try to program a remote that will work with it... or attempt to hang this on the wall with your standard wall mount.  The holes in the back are like 12 inches apart and didn't work with ALL three of the different mounts that I had handy.  I ended up leaving the metal bracket on the wall and attaching two round discs to the back of the tv (included) and hanging in on the existing bracket.  Worked....

Reviews.Title: Amazing for pc gaming!
Reviews.Author: Aaron
Reviews.Content: I bought this tv because the price and specs were just too good to pass up and im really glad i did!!! The tv has done an outstanding job at everything i have done with it so far and i love it! I also do some pc gaming such as skyrim/fallout/mass effect etc. on pc and i can't believe how good the display handles it! I was a little scared at first because some people were saying that anything above 60hz is bad for pc gaming because it will cause lag but when i connected the pc it automatically adjusted the hz setting to 60 so it was absolutely no issue! Very pleased with my purchase and shipping was very timely.

Reviews.Title: no frills... great picture
Reviews.Author: wrtump
Reviews.Content: What a deal:  great display, not bad sound... if you are looking for a great monitor at the right price, this is it.  Very impressed.  Looks better than a Sony I bought last year at three times the price.  Delivery was excellent.  Set it up for me and removed all the packaging.  QUALITY!

Reviews.Title: TCL LE48FHDF3300ZTA 48"
Reviews.Author: Big Ken
Reviews.Content: I was is the process of replacing my old CRT TV's with some of the newer LED, LCD and Plasma units. I have all of the above in house. We have several different brands Panasonic, Westinghouse and JVC in house. So I needed to replace one more unit and happened to see the TCL LED set. First I thought the unit was priced incorrectly ($498.00) but I was assured it was correct, I couldn't believe it. The unit was sandwiched in between some more pricier units (Samsung, LG and Sony)but the TCL stood out from the bunch, so after about 30 mins of tuning and comparison I purchased the TCL unit. Best purchase I have made in 2012, hands down. Mind you I didn't need Wi-Fi or 3D(D is for Dummies..lol)capabilities, other than that this TV smokes anything that a currently use. The picture is great the sound is ok but ( I have a surround sound package connected to the unit) so no problem there. Bottom line is if you can find a 48" LED unit for under 500 bucks with 1080p, 240hz refresh rate and a 2 year parts and labor warranty new in the box please let me know. You cannot go wrong with this TV.

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for the price!
Reviews.Author: Eric Altena
Reviews.Content: Product shipped quickly, set up easily, excellent picture and sound quality. Impressive refresh rate is noticeable in HD sports or action films. Well worth the price and would consider it again.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely beautiful
Reviews.Author: Shehzad Ahmed
Reviews.Content: Works great. For the price and its sleek design. I could not be happier. Yes it does not have that Wireless stuff but i hook up my PS3 to this and just great. If u want all those gizmos in your tv and want the best of the best- then go ahead and spend over 1000. But for the price of this TV- absolute steal- i bought this for myself as a Christmas present

Reviews.Title: I think I got a great deal for this size LED the detail is amazing
Reviews.Author: David Weaver
Reviews.Content: So far so good no complaints It has a nice solid stand for our entertainment center. I love it and no complaints

Reviews.Title: What's not to like
Reviews.Author: dougal
Reviews.Content: This is a great buy for the money.  Picture is sharp and it ewas easy to set up.  If it has a fault it would be the lack of connectors for accessorys.

Reviews.Title: Great TV but not 240hz
Reviews.Author: John
Reviews.Content: The TV is great, great picture quality for my PS3 but when i watch bluray movies, it does not act like a 240hz TV, it should have more realistic view than normal 60hz TV's. This TV is just 60hz, not 240hz like they said it is.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV!!
Reviews.Author: C. W. Stanford "Lama"
Reviews.Content: Never heard of this brand - but it is a great TV.  Very clear and bright picture.  I HIGHLY recommend this TV - at this astounding price.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic picture
Reviews.Author: Cam Thompson
Reviews.Content: Picture and sound are great.  I was a little concerned after reading a couple of the other reviews of units damaged in shipping but mine arrived perfect and has had no issues.  Have only had it for a few weeks so if anything changes I will amend my review.  Great price.

Reviews.Title: VERY HAPPY
Reviews.Author: Jeff Plotkin
Reviews.Content: Delivered promptly. Easy set up and it works like a champ. The best buy on the market. Beautiful picture. I would recommend anyone looking for an above quality picture!!!

Reviews.Title: Works with Dish controller
Reviews.Author: RetiredProf
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers I had never heard of TCL. I did some research, specifically comparing TCL to LG. The two seemed comparable and I was able to get a better deal on the TCL. I bought the 55 inch model to replace a 47 inch Philips. The threads for mounting the TV to the wall were different, so I had to go to Home Depot to buy four screws that fit. Other than that it went right on the same mount I had been using. However, the location of the holes was lower on the back which made it a little more difficult to mount. I saw some questions about using the DirecTV controller with this set. I have Dish Network, and like DirecTV, there was no code listed for any TCL models. However, using the scan mode I was able to find a setting the allowed the DVR controller to control the TV. It can turn the set on and off, change the volume and the input source, which is all I really needed. One interesting feature of this set is you can suppress some but not all of the unused input labels. This is nice when you are selecting the input source so you only need to choose from the ones that are active. You can't suppress the antenna input or the USB input labels. One final note - there are two similar models, one that ends in Z and one that ends in ZTA. I have been unable to tell how they are different. Even the TCL website lists them both but the specs appear identical. Bottom line: I am 100% satisfied with my purchase and would recommend the TCL model to anyone looking for a great value in a large screen LED HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding
Reviews.Author: James C
Reviews.Content: I was pretty nervous after reading some reviews of bad units.  Fortunately my fears were unfounded.  The TV arrived in flawless condition and worked perfectly.One thing I didn't see mentioned in the reviews was that if you use the glass stand that comes with the TV you will need to put 8 screws in.  Getting the screws into the base can be a little tricky and I got some resistance on some of them that worried me that I would strip the screws.The menus for the TV are pretty good.  I am using the "Vibrant" setting for video games and it looks absolutely fantastic with my PS3.  Netflix looks very good.This TV is BIG.  I didn't really know how big a 55" was since I upgraded from a 32 straight from Amazon.The free super saver shipping did not come from a normal company.  It was a logistics company that will schedule a delivery window with you.I had no dead pixels or lines of any kind in my unit.  It was absolutely a 5 star buy.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic deal
Reviews.Author: Dane
Reviews.Content: Really good T.V. I have not had any problems with it like the other reviews have mentioned. Best deal on this size T.V. and it made my dad super happy.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV! Great Value
Reviews.Author: M. Allen
Reviews.Content: Better than expected. Myself, along with 4 friends all purchased this TV. We're all very impressed with it. All 5 of our TV's look great, and I was SHOCKED at the sound quality from this TV. I have a surround system, so I don't use the built-in audio, but when I first hooked it up it sounded pretty dang good!Only wish is for at least 4 HDMI ports, although an HDMI splitter does the trick. I would like Optical Out from the TV. If you have a sound system that everything plugs into, then you dont need the optical out as everything goes into the receiver and then into the TV from 1 plug.

Reviews.Title: A Really Nice Budget TV
Reviews.Author: Dave P.
Reviews.Content: I purchased the 48" TCL Model TV for my home office. I have a Samsung UN55B8000 and a Sony Bravia at home as well. I thought for under $500, and with good reviews, I would take the chance. I was pleasantly surprised with picture quality of this set. If you have reasonable expectations (not comparing this TV to a $1,500 Unit, require 3D, or Internet connectivity) this very well might meet your needs. I normally don't keep my electronics very long as I like to upgrade when noticeably better technology is available. This set may find its way to the garage in the future. Right now (as long as its working) staying in my office for a long time. My sources are broadcast TV and streaming content from a PS3.Pros:InexpensiveNice PictureSlim Black Frame Around PictureFast Trouble Free ShippingNot Dealing with a Box RetailerCons:Internal Speakers are not great (fixed with a inexpensive sound bar)Remote Control Feels CheapTCL LE48FHDF3300ZTA 48-Inch 1080p 240Hz LED HDTV with 2-Year Limited Warranty (Black)

Reviews.Title: Great TV that doesn't have unneeded extras
Reviews.Author: Buger
Reviews.Content: I ordered the TCL LE55FHDF3300ZTA from Amazon as I didn't want to try and fight the crowds for the Walmart 60" deal on black Friay.  Immediately afterward I had a little buyers remorse as I saw there were 47" and 50" TVs that were priced so low on black Friday but I have been completely happy after putting the TV up.We mainly wanted a larger TV with a great picture but didn't need to have extras like internet, netflix, 3d, etc.  We already have a internet connected home theater and WDTVLive so just wanted a nice bigger screen and we are completely happy.  The TV has 2 HDMI inputs along with component, composite and PC inputs.  At first, we had a problem with the aspect ratio on some shows/commercials where the picture did not fully fill the screen (black bars on sides and/or top).  On our old TV, there was a display option to change the aspect ratio on the TV but on the TCL it took some time for me to figure out to use the "zoom" button which cycles through the different ratios (the answer was actually in the manual).The only bad part about our experience was the free delivery from Amazon which used CEVA logistics but I won't mark down the TV rating for it.  I got an email from domain EAGLE1.CEVALOGISTICS.COM advising to call CEVA to schedule the delivery once the TV arrived at our city.  I called the next day and spent about 10 minutes on the phone as I was passed to 4 other people before being told that they couldn't take any schedule from me yet and that I should wait until someone calls me.2 days later, I got another email saying CEVA called my home# and left a voicemail and that I should call them ASAP to schedule delivery.  I checked and none of our contact#s had any voicemail or caller id from unknown #s.  I called CEVA back and was passed to a couple of other people who took the info on when to deliver and to call my wife cell phone before coming.  The next day CEVA called our home # again instead of my wife's cell phone # but did deliver the TV.So in summary, great TV but beware CEVA logistics if you're using the free standard shipping.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic TV at a great price!
Reviews.Author: Beau Regard "Lexus Lover"
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV based on many of the reviews on Amazon.com.  I have had the TV for one week, and I absolutely love it.  The picture is nothing short of amazing, crisp and clear and vibrant.  The sound quality is good, and is quite clear.  You can crank the volume up quite a bit without any distortion.  I am not an audiophile, but I think it sounds great.  Some people say the remote sucks, but I have no problems with it at all.  The TV and remote does everything I need it to do.  I don't need 3D or any of that other mumbo-jumbo, I just need an HD TV that does its job very well.  So far, I am quite happy with my purchase.  I paid $ 750 for the TV, and with Tax it came out to $ 825.  They delivered the TV and set it up fpr me, and I made sure the picture was good before I signed the delivery invoice.  I will definitely recommend this TV to anyone, the picture is absolutely incredible!  I will just have to wait and see how long this TV will last.  I had a 50" rear projection TV that last for 28 years, no less!  If this LED TV lasts for 10 or 15 years I will be quite happy with that.  So time will tell.  So far, so good........If you decide to get this TV, I think you will be quite pleased.......... God Bless and Best Wishes!

Reviews.Title: TCL
Reviews.Author: paul desimone
Reviews.Content: This LED has an awesome picture and for the price of 699.00 it is truly worth every penny. I would recommend this to all my friends. thanks

Reviews.Title: great price!
Reviews.Author: andrea eckert
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing buy for a 55 ince tv. It has amazing picture and even better sound quality. My husband loves it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Greg H
Reviews.Content: Excellent picture and price. Got this for cheap on black friday, but it is still a steal at current price. As other reviewers have noted, the sound isn't ideal for everyday use. With a 55" tv, you probably have some kind of audio unit so this shouldn't be an issue. It's fairly thin and light enough for one guy to pick up. The thin bezel is a huge plus.One inconvenience that may not apply to you: Lack of RCA audio-out connection. Previously, I had cable box, apple tv, and xbox audio going into the tv and from there to the audio box (so you don't have to change audio inputs, just video). I solved this using the TV's 3.5mm headphone jack and a $2 adapter for RCA.Worth the price given the speakers and missing output connectors? For 55" at this price, definitely.

Reviews.Title: 2 weeks after delivery, I love this TV
Reviews.Author: MI Hockey Mom
Reviews.Content: I did a great deal of research before selecting this TV. My list of requirements: a LED 50-55" screen, 240 Hz, adequate number of HDMI ports, at least a 1 year warranty, under $1000, and a significant number of favorable reviews by home buyers. Items I removed from my initial list were 3D (most reviews of 3D on HDTV were negative), internet connection (since external devices could provide this as well if not better), and a quality sound (since I intend to connect to a 5.1 home theater). The only TV that met all of my requirements was the TCL.I was nervous when the TV arrived (based on some Amazon reviewer experiences) and anxious to plug it but the delivery men STRONGLY advised to let the TV sit for at least 4 hours to adapt to home climate before taking it out of the packaging and plugging it in (it was around 32 degrees the day my TCL arrived). So I let the delivery men go and waited 4 hours. During that time I checked the internet and did find some information regarding potential condensation problems on the electronics as cold tvs warm up and some concerns about the liquid part of the LED screen in extremely cold weather. I figure better safe than sorry so I waited.I've had this TV running now for about 2 weeks. I love the clarity and color. Blacks are deep, no fading. All pixels are working. I am using an antenna with rabbit ears and I get about a dozen stations but just purchased a directional HDTV antenna and will be setting that up in the attic later this week. The HD stations are just as good as the cable pictures I used to get on a 52" Sony Bravia I had back a few years ago. I don't like any of the picture presets (color too strong, faces too red) but with some fine tuning, I am very happy with my personal settings. I did use the sports setting last night to watch my first football game and the green and gold uniforms looked as fantastic as Rodgers' passes.The Blu-Ray DVDs are also just beautiful on this TV. I am running my HP desktop through an HDMI connection to the TCL. It took some time and patience to work across 2 monitors get the correct PC screen resolution on the TCL and to get the HDMI sound working. Thankfully I found the solutions on internet forums and through trial and error.I would not be able to listen to the speakers provided in this TV, maybe because I accustomed to higher quality audio systems.As long as this TV continues to perform for the next several years as it is right now, I will be extremely happy with my decision to forgo the better known brand names and the extra features.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price.
Reviews.Author: AudiNick
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV around Black Friday and have had a couple of weeks to try it out.I have been very pleased with the picture quality of the set as well as the viewing angle.The placement of the speakers (on the bottom pointing down) were not ideal for my situation as I had the set in a tv recess above my fireplace.  This caused the sound to be muffled.Placement of the speakers led me to purchasing a sound bar (Vizio VSB200) for better sound.  This led me to discover that there is only an SPDIF audio output.  That output type is coaxial RCA and because of that I needed to purchase an adapter for the sound bar.The unit only has 2 hdmi inputs and while it isn't a deal breaker I would love to have at least 1 more available.The last is it claims to be 240Hz but hdmi input is limited to 60Hz.  Again not a deal breaker for me but I was expecting it to be at least 120Hz.I think this is a great television for the price and would buy it again.Pros:Picture clarityWeightCons:Only 2 hdmi outputsSPDIF out put is RCA not TOSLINK.Only has SPDIF audio output.  Limits the lower end sound bar options.

Reviews.Title: Amazing Picture
Reviews.Author: B. Herbster "room mother"
Reviews.Content: I bought this television Thanksgiving weekend. I was a little concerned with it being an "off-brand" item. We were switching from a Sony Wega HD. I didn't have any trouble with set-up. As other reviewers have stated, pre-programmed picture and sound settings are very helpful and user friendly. I paired it with a Sony BDP-S185 Blu-Ray player I bought last week, phenomenal picture. I played a little Call of Duty:Black Ops Zombies this afternoon and was blown away. Far better picture than I had with my Sony projection screen. Crisp and bright zombie content.**On a side note--shipping. I did not factor this into my rating of this item. It was shipped using AGS, which bills their shipping as "white glove delivery" that is by appointment. I received an email from them saying that they would call on the next business day to schedule delivery for Friday. They didn't call. I called them Monday afternoon. They said that the local delivery people would call Wednesday to set up an appointment. No call. I called Thursday and said that delivery was supposed to be Friday and I needed to reach someone to set up appointment. They immediately set up an appointment (can't understand why couldn't have done that when I called the first time) and said that the earliest they could deliver was Monday (today). I complained, but let them set up the appointment. They asked if I wanted a 12-3 window or a 3-6 window. I said 3-6. I checked online later and they set my appointment for 12-3. I've been extremely irritated all weekend, but I couldn't make any plans for Friday because I expected delivery until Thursday afternoon and then I had to blow off my plans with my children today because I didn't know if they would deliver during the wrong window or if they would deliver when I told them to deliver. Delivery arrived at 12:30 without calling ahead. Deliverymen were not with AGS. They worked for Baton Rouge Air Freight. Really nice guys. Set up the tv, offered to take the trash, but suggested I keep it just in case I had any problems.

Reviews.Title: 2 days out of the box review...
Reviews.Author: SkullCowboy
Reviews.Content: Ordering and getting the TV happened with typical Amazon efficiency so no complaints there.I am not an AV guru by any stretch. This my first HD TV. All my experience is in what I have watched at my friends/relatives/local sports bar. So merit my opinion with that in mind.Was a little leery of buying an 'off' brand, but some research and reading various reviews, along with the price and 2 year warranty pushed me into it. Seems to be some talk about poor customer support, but I have found that to be a pretty universal problem more and more. Trick is to pray you get a working device to begin with. I picked this model also for the feature set, or more to the point, lack of. You can spend several hundred dollars more for online smart features on the TV, or $50.00 more on the Blue Ray player for the same stuff. Easy choice for me.Setup was painless. Plenty of connections for my purposes as the only thing that will be plugged into it will be my cable box and a Blu Ray player (yet to arrive). Had it hooked up to my Uverse box and functioning in 15 minutes (some of that was just playing with menus). Had to wait about another hour for my HD signal to get turned on by AT$T though. (Remember above, first HD TV. And yes I did order HD turned on before hand, took a followup call to get it working).Results? For my untrained eyes, pretty damn stunning. Watched some football games (GO TEXANS!!!), then flipped back and forth between some movies (some action types, some not) and some regular stuff like news and a cooking show. Picture is crystal clear and colors are amazing. A night time overhead shot of Cowboy Stadium looked like I was there. No funny textures on the blacks. Never noticed any ghosting or blurring on the sports or action movies. Even my wife, who was not really on board for this (and the Blu Ray player and the HD channel fee from AT$T, etc) was impressed.I'll mention sound just to say the built in speakers are about what I've experienced in any TV I've ever owned. Nothing special. That's why I have surround sound fed from whatever source I am using.I haven't received my Blu Ray player yet so if I see something icky once I get that hooked up I'll update my review. If ya don't hear back, means I am happy with that, too.

Reviews.Title: EXCELLENT  Led HDTV for smart buyer
Reviews.Author: eiuy4615
Reviews.Content: Ordered on Saturday after black friday, received on Wednesday with free shipping, watched for 2 days.  I am very pleased with this TV, EXCELLENT picture, reasonable sound quality. I congrated myself right away.Give TCL 2 more years, I belive It will become one of the top seller on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: First returned 2nd so far so good!
Reviews.Author: S. Siders
Reviews.Content: I received the first 48" and the picture looked great except for a fingernail size dead spot right of center towards the top. I performed the 'return and replace defective product' option in my Amazon orders list and Amazon automatically scheduled a UPS pickup the next day as well as placed another order for the same TV.My 2nd 48" arrived a few days later and I love it. The sound is great and the picture looks sharp and clear as expected. I was particular to this model due to three reasons- Price was under $500- 2 year manufacturer warranty- Has a PC hookup if I want to use it.I would have given it a 5 out of 5 if not for having to return the first, but I was only out the hassle of detaching the stand and repacking it in the box.

Reviews.Title: Great Value Killer LED TV
Reviews.Author: Terrell L Bowman
Reviews.Content: This is the first LED TV that I've ever purchased.  This TV compares with the Vizo's and Samsung's of the world.  I plugged this TV in and instantly feel in love with the vibrant colors and the huge screen.  This TV will round out your entertainment center and will be the talk of the party...I order this TV and second guessed my self due to the brand...but once I got the TV I could be happier with the research that I had done.  I would recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: so far so good...
Reviews.Author: kyloslandry
Reviews.Content: so far, could not be happierdid quite a bit of research, and decided to go with this onewatched the SEC champ game tonight- fantastic

Reviews.Title: Amazing TV
Reviews.Author: D. Allaby "Doug"
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good thing about this TV. Speakers aren't as bad as some reviews say. Picture is fantastic especially in HD. Best $479.00 I've ever spent on a tv. Didn't like the presets for sound or picture, so I adjusted to my liking and everything is great.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: dennis maynard
Reviews.Content: I am really happy with this TV. We had a 42", this 55" is great for us old folks that have a hard time seeing. The sound is great, no distortion. Great color.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV FOR PRICE
Reviews.Author: kelly
Reviews.Content: I got this tv a few weeks ago, i wanted to give it a little time before I left a review.Gret tv for the price, bezel is small and picture is great. Would have gotten 5 stars but sound isn't the best.Get a sound bar and its an amazing set up that looks like it cost way more then it does.55 inches at 1080 for 700 cannot be beat.I was worried about shipping but they brought it in my house, set it up and made sure everything worked before I had to sign for it. Very nice delivery men awesome service.I would recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: Very Happy with this 55' LED TV
Reviews.Author: John Abdel-jabbar
Reviews.Content: After waiting a couple of years I decided to get a larger TV. I was looking for quality image at a lower price point. The specs I was looking at all TVs were above $1200 price point. This TCL was $699.00 with the same specs less the WiFi and the built in software, which I did not need because I am using Dish HD programming. The purchase was easy, the delivery prompt and they called in advance to schedule a delivery time. They unpacked the TV and tested it to make sure it turns on. There was no damage that I could see. I have installed it on the wall and am very happy. If you don't need the WiFi and built in software like Hulu or Netflix then this is a very good purchase. One thing that it's not mentioned is that you cannot adjust the Hz on this TV, I guess it is set at 240Hz and that's that. Also, if you have a universal remote control and want to program for this TV you will need to use the RCA codes, there are no TCL remote codes in the manual. You may have to try several RCA codes, I spent about 2 hrs trying different codes and finally found one that worked. Now all is well that ends well. Hope this was helpful.

Reviews.Title: TCL 48" HDTV 1080p
Reviews.Author: Jbreitsch
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV on black friday to replace and old 50" HD projection TV.
