First I have to say the shipping was AWESOME, I place my order friday at 4pm, it was shipped later that night. I got 2 day shipping, and it was expected on wednesday. I recieved this on Monday. Two full days before the expected date. Those results are just amazing.I was nervous this TV would lack in style, picture, and overall features. I didnt want a 3D TV simply because I dont want to the extra a month and I dont want to wear glasses. Also I didnt want internet connection because I bought a blu ray player with internet and that saved me money. This TV was the best price I could find anywear, and it had 4 stars. I risked the $500 and bought it.When I recieved this TV, much earlier than expected, I was thrilled with the size, Not too big, and definately not to small. I love the dimensions. I wasnt expecting it to be super slim like those $1000+, but it is SLIM. The bezel is awesome, its heavy, sturdy, and stylish, all things you want to hold your new purchase.The remote it came with is a pretty standard remote, works fine, looks fine, nothing special. But it gets the job done!The picture blew me away. I was expecting the same picture that my old TV gave me but in a slimmer TV. I was wrong! This TV looks like the best TV you will find at a electronics store. I invited my friends from college over and we are all engineering majors, so alot of technical savvy people. Everyone that saw the TV thought I payed 800+.Some cons are that it isnt super slim, no internet connection, and there was no program code for my universal remote, but a simple code scan with the remote will find the TV code and then it works fine.Overall I believe this whole process deserves 5 stars.. And the TV itself is amazing, especially for the price! And it came with a 2 year warranty! Im so pleased with this purchase.

Reviews.Title: 5 star quality
Reviews.Author: Cody-Ray
Reviews.Content: Great picture quality and the television itself looks great. This brand was recommended to me by a friend who sells televisions for a living. For the price, the quality is amazing. Great customer service by Amazon as always and a worthy product.

Reviews.Title: Broke within 1 month
Reviews.Author: James Costantini
Reviews.Content: I got the TV early January. Delivery was great and the picture was awesome. I was very happy.  Three days ago, a 6" strip on the left side start to flash and show non-sense bars.I turned it off, unplugged it, tried to reset it and everything. It goes off for a bit, then comes on again. When it is on, the tv is unwatchable.Long story short, I reached out to TCL support but haven't heard back. I got rid of the box, so i'm not expecting much, especially as Amazon does not get returns.Moral of the story: don't by a cheap tv. I learned the hard way

Reviews.Title: Didn't work
Reviews.Author: Ziggernaut
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing. I got it out of the box and the remote didn't work and the TV was dead on arrival. Tried to call customer support several times, but I got their message during their advertised support hours. When I finally got through, the support rep kept asking me to do support tasks I had already done from the website and didn't seem to speak enough English to understand this. Finally I got a number to the second tier of support and they said i would need to repair the TV or return it. It's on its way back to Amazon!

Reviews.Title: basic good quality screen
Reviews.Author: symbioticKid
Reviews.Content: Reading the prior 24 reviews before my purchase, I took on the risk fully knowing that i was either going to be the unlucky few who got a shitty piece delivered or most of the lucky folks who were absolutely loving their new TV.I'm glad to say I belong to the latter group. The UPS guy delivered the TV to the apartment front office [and not my 3rd floor apartment - bummer], so that was a bit of a bust. But managed to haul the TV back to my place.Screwed in the base, turned it on and wolah .. the screen looks amazing!! Put in my Dark Knight blue-ray, and the picture quality is top-notch. I'd put it the same ball park as those $1000 TV's out there. Nice colors, and simple picture settings to choose from. I'm not a knit-picky video person, but compared to the Vizio [240Hz] my friend has, this TV is right up there.Plugged in my indoor-antenna, scan and found 22 local channels in HD. Worked like a charm.Its a fairly thin/light weight TV. No frills/no wifi/no smart apps [i don't need them anyway, i've a roku], just a nice pretty screen with easy to navigate remote options.And for $479, don't see better deals out there.Good luck!

Reviews.Title: 240hz seems non-existent. Vibrant colors but Grainy
Reviews.Author: Daine
Reviews.Content: I've had the 55" TV for the past 3 days now and been playing with the options/settings, connected to the blu ray player(PS3), Xbox 360, HD enable media etc..I rate this 3 star because of the 240hz advertise is deceptive. I did the Side by Side comparison with my old Toshiba 42" Regza LCD TV and the quality is somewhat similar. The only difference is the size and the LED backlight that the TCL 55" has. And for the 240hz, it does not seem existentI was hoping that that this TV is cleaner and crisper but it has that Grainy look no matter how much I change the settings.  I think this what everyone fails to mention, the noise/grainy.If TCL comes out with a firmware Update with a tweak, I will update my review.UPDATE:Okay, I said I would update my review if there's a firmware update but in this case it will be towards the quality of the TV.The quality is outstanding, I must have been watching some old blu-ray movies to test the quality of the TV. However, I have been watching recent releases movies and this TV delivers, just plainly beautifulAs for gaming it's amazing, I just played the demo of "God of War Ascension" and the graphics is absolutely mind blowing, i didn't see any motion blur, no latency issue. It brings that vibrant colors of the game to WOW your eyes.

Reviews.Title: Best HDTV I have ever owned. And I have owned a lot.
Reviews.Author: Cold Ethyl
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable picture quality!!I have 13 coffee shops here in my state and I have 4 to 5 HDTV's in each one. The picture on this 48" TCL has given me more compliments on how it looks in the past week than my Sony,Samsung's,Vizio's,or Panasonic's ever have in the past year. And for those that care about the cost of an item, this TCL cost less than half.My settings given to me by others here that work remarkable....Backlight- 49Contrast- 80Brightness- 50Color- 62Light sensor-OffNoise reduction-lowSharpness-50Contrast is amazing. Blacks and whites and all colors are fantastic. Watching from every angle is just as clear as well. I put on great quality blu rays like, "Tron Legacy", "Jaws", "Fright Night" and "Return Of The Living Dead" and was blown away! Then put on DVDs that weren't 1080p...."Son Of The Beach", "Bubba Ho Tep" and "Disturbing Behavior". I WAS BLOWN AWAY!! I picked "Bubba" and "Disturbing" because they are very dark films so if any trouble with picture quality could pop up, it would have. But it didn't.Please believe me, I don't work for TCL. If you need proof of that, my complaint is having only 2 hdmi's for a tv this size is kinda stupid. But, it's not the end of the world. Remove one, insert the other.The final thing I'll say and I know not many people know this and a lot would disagree, but the higher you set your backlight the sooner you will have technical problems with your TV. It took a while for me to get companies to tell me what is safe or not but eventually they did when I told them I wouldn't buy from them again if they didn't.If you set your backlight higher than 50% you will have a bigger chance of technical difficulties sooner than if you didn't. Finally, Sony, Samsung, Vizio and Panasonic and Sharp admitted this.The reason why this is important when it comes to this TCL is because the setting I mentioned earlier are excellent quality picture settings that do not work on the other brands. I have to set my Sony's and Samsung's much much higher than my TCL to get close to the quality I want.In other words I get a better picture with my TCL at a much safer longer lasting setting than I do with my TV's that are double the cost.P.S.I hardly ever praise something, but this TV was worth it. So much so, I bought another for my house after installing this in my shop.(Sorry I didn't shut up!)

Reviews.Title: Hope you all get a better unit than I did
Reviews.Author: A Keith-mocker
Reviews.Content: My low review is for the faulty unit I got. I feel it's justified since TCL should really test these things out before shipping them. If anyone else out there bought this, I really hope you received a better unit than I did. After the delivery service tested it to get the blue screen, they left, I assembled the base and got it on the stand. I hooked up my xbox, blue ray, and mac mini, and ran the scan for my leaf antenna. As soon as a full screen picture came up, I noticed three really bright dots in the upper left side, vertically aligned. I hoped they would go away as the unit warmed up. No, been over an hour and they are still there. I called their customer service number in the manual (which they call "Level 1") and they could not help me with the general quick fix suggestions - unplug it and plug it back in, unplug all inputs and plug them back in, etc. So, they gave me to "Level 2" support. Their suggestion was to call Amazon and have them replace it since it would take 3 to 4 weeks for TCL to fix it.Rather than replace it, though, I think I am done trying out these cheaper brands. My 37" Samsung has been great for 4 years now. I'm sticking with that brand since Samsung already has my trust.HOWEVER, I should let you all know that the picture seems fine otherwise. I was initially worried about the response time, but have noticed no streaking. Color looks good and there are a lot of options for you to play with to get the settings you want. If price is more of an object than reliability, go for this television! I bought it because some forums said TCL makes panels for Samsung. I thought it was worth a gamble, but I lost.BTW, the only audio out is for digital coaxial, no composite or optical. Couldn't see that very well from the photos, and this item page on Amazon doesn't list all the available ports like other HDTV pages do. The unit's speakers are typical HDTV cruddy, so plan accordingly.UPDATE: Turns out, you have to turn on the TV first before consoles or whatever you have it plugged into. Otherwise it was only displaying my xbox at 480p, and there was no way for me to change it in the TV's menu! Plus, the sound would not work - not through the headphone jack which I've plugged 2.1 Yamaha into, nor through the TV's own speakers. I shut everything off and made sure the TV was first on this time and it all seems better now. But really, this is a very bad sign. Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Grainy Picture
Reviews.Author: Jedi Mustafa "Hadoken"
Reviews.Content: I've owned two other 1080p televisions made by different brands and this one is the first that made me question if the picture is actually HD. I checked settings, did research on other people's experiences, and looked at their website, and now I'm convinced that the TV itself just doesn't deliver on the 1080p promise, and if it does, the quality is a lot worse than other 1080 tvs.The picture is grainy, and my friend's 720p Panasonic has a much more impressive picture.Sad that I have to return it.You get what you pay for I guess.

Reviews.Title: TCL LE55FHDF3300ZTA 55-Inch 1080p 240Hz - Rating will depend on expectations
Reviews.Author: Duhkgeorge "Bashfull user"
Reviews.Content: I have a 70" sharp 3D at 240hz.  Picture quality is beyond incredible.  I have to start my description with that statement because, based on reviews, I was hoping for an incredible TV, basic, at a low price.  This TV is not incredible.  Frankly, if I had seen this TV in the display room before purchase, I wouldn't have purchased for the price, but I have become incredibly spoiled and I understand that is influencing my decision.Physical:Approx 1/2" bezel in front.  It LOOKS like a slim TV, but it's about 2-3" deep.  the deeper part is more towards the center of the monitor on the back and so not extremely noticeable.The base is glass.  Looks nice.LED back-lit (which is why it's thicker)So, what's not to love about this TV from my perspective?Fast motion blurs.  I'm really disappointed in this and it is my biggest gripe based on the TV stats.Screen has a static feel to it.  (the many LED lights coming on and going off when screens pan, can be noticeable and causes the static/raining effect)Text is NOT crisp.  this surprised me the most and is noticeable when the start up screen with branding first comes on.Blue-rays don't look... well... sharp and crystal clear.Pros:The TV itself looks nice.It worked, although mine came out of the box upside down...  amusing.Amazon is currently including white glove delivery to whatever floor/room.  They won't set-up the stand, but will pull out the TV and plug it in to make sure it's in good condition and you get the menu/start screen.$17 a year energy rating.So, should MY cons influence you to not purchase this TV or am I really just too picky?  It will really depend.  I highly recommend you see it in the store and judge for yourself but I'll try to list reasons it would and would not work for you down below.Why this might work for you:It's a Monitor, it works (so far), and other cheap models have the same quality of which this is the cheapest.The monitor itself looks nice (physically, not the screen)If you're upgrading from a smaller cheap model, this is just a larger cheap model.You're like my wife and not that picky (although she notices a few things, she doesn't notice a lot that I do)Did I mention this was cheap?  It'll depend on what the sale price is but you can snag it for as low as $599 both on and off of Amazon.Why it might not:You're used to high end displays and are spoiled and can't return to a lesser display, because this IS a lesser display.  I wouldn't even put it at mid-level.  Not low end, but low mid-level for sure.These supposed great specs are comparable to lesser spec'd TV's.  (I believe these specs are incorrect or someone is getting away with lying via technicalities, but I'm not an AV tech geek, just my impression.)If service is important, you may be disappointed based on reviews I've read.Fast motion blurring will bother you.FULL SCREEN DVD ISSUE - stretches to fit screen instead of boxing.So, I have this TV and I'll be checking it out over the next year.  I wouldn't have purchased if I'd seen it before hand, but I have it now, so we'll see.  As normal for me, I'll be updating based on experience.  A lack of update will likely mean it's working and no issues as I tend to review around a month, three month, half year, and year time periods and I tend to be extremely busy so I don't always get around to updating at exactly those points unless I'm irked in which case I'd do it before those time points.***update 2013.05.09***I'm updating sooner than I expected with observations.1.)  Angle of view is pretty good.  I have a 32" in the same room that I just mounted for the treadmill and it's incredibly noticeable.  It also has fantastic brightness.2.)  I've been looking at text closer to see why it's "broken".  The tiny squares go dark in the middle of text for some reason.  I'm not sure why.  Sometimes it seems to flicker a little.3.)  After having used the screen a bit, the text issue is the most noticeable thing.  The rest I'm beginning to ignore.4.)  DVD FULL SCREEN ISSUE!!!!  If you have DVD's in full screen, this TV STRETCHES the image to fit.  A huge irritation as this is the TV designated to play all the old crappy DVD's.  Luckily most my old widescreens DVDs are on netflix.5.)  A bit of a cloudy issue with black/grey colors.  Most people won't notice and if you're the type to notice this may not be the TV for you.Overall, the TV is okay.  If the TV had different advertised specs this would be a three star review, but the specs don't equal the what I would expect from the TV I received so it's two stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture/Great Valu
Reviews.Author: Walt Bates
Reviews.Content: Only had this before unheard of TCL brand LED TV for three days.  It is a quality unit with a "glass base."  The price of this unit and the two year warranty pushed me to buy out of my normal, name brand range.  I think this is an up and coming brand and has a crystal clear picture.  Would have rated it a 5 star, had I owned it more than 3 days.  It is a little early in this units life for me to truly evaluate....but I'm impressed.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Value
Reviews.Author: Atonement
Reviews.Content: This 48" TLC was a great addition to my living room. Replacing an older LG plasma screen (42"), it was an obvious upgrade in terms of contrast with almost no noticeable decrease in dynamic colouring.A couple concerns, one known, one unknown to me on purchase:only two HDMI ports. It was in the description, got what I paid for, etc etc, but I still would have appreciated more. However, not a big deal.More interestingly: The stand doesn't swivel in any way, shape, or form. This TV faces the direction you place it unless you want to move the entire stand with it, which is no easy task w/ the rubber grips anchoring it down. I wasn't accustomed to this, as all other TVs before this TLC had the ability to swivel on their axis at least 30 degrees.Lastly, and I'm not sure this is the fault of the TV, only that it's a new issue, my desktop to which I've hooked the TV up will sometimes lose the audio connection to the TV's HDMI link. A quick solution to this (windows 7 64bit): Windows+P, select "Projecter Only," allowing your rig to attempt to find a projecter, only to default back to the TV out and "reboot" the connection, reestablishing the audio link.All in all, good TV, a couple unexpected issues, but nothing that isn't manageable.

Reviews.Title: great pioture and easy setup
Reviews.Author: jrbruce Bruce
Reviews.Content: Placed in bedroom and programed easy setup and great pictureI would by this set again or the 55" set

Reviews.Title: Have it for about 2 mos now.
Reviews.Author: R. Toro
Reviews.Content: First, the TV looks great with its slim line edges.  The TV screen looks full size and very impressive when hung on the wall.  The picture is great!  Shipping and packaging was great too.  The only issues if any is the sound. They went a little cheap on the speakers and it doesn't give that deep surround feel other compatible TVs give. I may pickup a soundbar to help with that. My TV is situated in a fairly large room and that may contribute to the sound quality, so it may be better in a smaller sized room. For the price, I really don't think there is anything close to the 240hz and size.  I also like the fact that TCL is US based. Even though I'm sure their parts come from elsewhere.  They are worth the shot.

Reviews.Title: So far, great
Reviews.Author: Nefaninnm "nefaninnm"
Reviews.Content: Only had for a day and love the picture.  Can tweak a fair amount of settings and can't wait for the Disney WOW blu-ray calibration disc.  With just the eyeball test and watching parts of two blu-ray movies, am happy with the picture and advanced settings to fine tune.  Viewing angles very good.

Reviews.Title: Mid level quality and great price
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline Bonn
Reviews.Content: Not the best picture in the world but definitely great value for the money. Works for our purposes of sports and movies

Reviews.Title: 55 inch HDTV
Reviews.Author: John Kohan
Reviews.Content: Good transaction ...fair price ...fast delivery .  This TV works fine ;  but on some cable channels [not HD ] ...the picture is somewhat blurry or snowy .  I think it is just the incoming signal ... not a big deal.

Reviews.Title: Good TV until it broke.  Warranty did cover repair, though.
Reviews.Author: old jeezy
Reviews.Content: Bought it in late December.  Was watching it the following mid March and the TV shut off and wouldn't come back on.Initially I had a little trouble getting through to TCL's customer service, but once I did things went reasonably well.  They sent me a box of parts that came via UPS four days after my initial call, and they put me in touch with a repair guy.  He showed up and seemed to have a pretty routine time replacing some boards and getting my TV back up and running.  He said that they had recalled the original set of boards and that the new ones he installed should be more reliable.The screen itself is pretty much what I expected.  I'm not an expert but my eyeballs have no qualms with the picture quality.  Having only two HDMI ports is certainly a limitation, but not one that I didn't know about when I made the purchase.If the TV hadn't broken I'd be giving it 4 stars.  Of course, it did break.  I don't think I'd buy a TCL again.  While the 2-year warranty did come through for me, I think a more reputable brand would be a much safer bet--even if you have to pay a little more for it.

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth taking the chance.
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Was hesitant at first. I read the reviews and decided to give it a shot. Definitely worth the money! Great value and works well.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: kfireaway
Reviews.Content: Still going strong over a year later, good quality and good picture haven't had a single problem yet, and hope I dont

Reviews.Title: Great picture
Reviews.Author: Lawrence W. Zeni
Reviews.Content: The quality of the image on this set is first rate.  The sound is pretty decent as well.  The only complaint is that it take quite a while to power up.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: m
Reviews.Content: I have had this tv for a year and a half and I absolutely love it. CLear picture and nice slim look.

Reviews.Title: DAMAGED ITEM
Reviews.Author: matt
Reviews.Content: Fair warning...this is a returned/damaged item. Don't buy this 55 inch with 2 year limited warranty.  I bought it and had the shippers unpackage it and test it, etc like they are suppose to.  Half the screen is blacked out with a line through it.  Do not buy, you will just return it like I did.

Reviews.Title: Best TV I Have Seen or Had and at a Great Price
Reviews.Author: JCIV
Reviews.Content: The picture is fantastic. The sounds is fantastic. It truly looks like a high end flat screen. While a bottom portio of the tv is fatter then the rest, when viewing movies or shows you can't see it and the tv appears to be just the thinnest screeen ever. The is nor more then a half inch of bezel around the screen. Coming from my Samsung this is awesome. There was 1-2 inches all around, and this just utilizes so much more of the 55".Sorry for the poorly written review, but Im short on time.Only downside is only 2 HDMI ports, but generally you will never need more then two at a time.

Reviews.Title: Prewarn don't lose your remote control
Reviews.Author: Bouapha C.
Reviews.Content: Had it for over a year. Great tv for price but it won't turn on. Did some troubleshooting, found out the tv might be lock and I could use my remote to turn it on. Big problem, my puppy ate the remote two weeks prior.Called customer service, was told I need a tcl remote control. I could get a controller from amazon for 17.99 but wait a month or get it from a dealer for 35 plus 15 dollar to ship from cal for ups ground. Didn't trust the person or number called, won't have a problem if I didn't feel like I was calling some house.So lesson learn, don't let your puppy eat the remote, and make sure you go out and buy another one right away.

Reviews.Title: aint worth it
Reviews.Author: Pablo
Reviews.Content: less than a year in and the tv has grey/black clouds intruding from the sides that cant be adjusted again. hey, live and learn. i shuda bought a samsung/sony/sharp

Reviews.Title: Good TV.
Reviews.Author: Ed Napier - Attorney At Law
Reviews.Content: I use it as a computer monitor in my office. I love it.  Great price at the time.  Still pretty good.  I've had it over a year without any trouble.

Reviews.Title: Better than your neighbors $1200 TV and $500 less too
Reviews.Author: Ian Steffy
Reviews.Content: This TV's price is on the rise for a reason. I don't think I could have been more pleased with this purchase. Video games and high-def movies look jaw-dropping. A warning to all; this TV will probably get everyone in your house horribly addicted to

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Kay
Reviews.Content: Great TV for the price!  No complaints yet...  Of course we have only had it for three weeks - but delivery and set up was a snap.  Beautiful picture.

Reviews.Title: Joining the poor-customer service/warranty club
Reviews.Author: K. Reischl "book addict"
Reviews.Content: 1/20//14: Our TV is taking up to 10 minutes to turn on. I bought it back in November 2012.So, I called into support (for the first time - see below for second). I told the guy what the issue was and was told the voltage in house too low. I told him was working fine for year and that lately it takes up 10 minutes to turn on. Support rep kept saying not enough voltage to keep it on so it would shut down to recharge.... I kept telling him that the TV does not shut off and that was not the problem. The problem was taking up to 10 minutes to turn on. He kept repeating our problem is that it shuts off and I finally started yelling at him "NO that's not our problem". He still kept at the voltage problem, and so I hung up and called back in to hopefully get someone else.I called back and luckily got a different person - woohoo! I explained the problem and he asked what I tried so far, which is nothing. He instructed me to unplug from surge protector and put directly into the wall. Makes sense - maybe the surge protector is funky. I did that and turned on the TV, which took several minutes to start up again. This is the fun part: He says well its working so just continue to bypass surge protector, and if that doesn't work plug into a different outlet and call back in 3 days if still having problems!!I asked why does he consider it working in that it took several minutes for the TV to turn?  He says is the TV on and working right now?  Yes, I said. Well then its working fine according to him!  Again I repeated the delay in turning it on and he said that could be normal. I called bull-sugar on that statement, and he repeated to keep it off the surge protector for 3days and monitor it. WHAT THE FUDGE?? I get that TV's fail, and I get that sometimes customer service sucks, but this is just ridiculous!So, if that's how they are going to play, I can play. Next update in "3 days".....

Reviews.Title: TCL LED Tv
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: To start , this is a beautiful Tv and each person who has seen it has commented on how good the picture it. But i am annoyed that it is listed as 240Hz and I have yet to find any at half that. Though, most times, you get what you pay for. Been using it for about a month. Roughly 2 months after use began, the TV started making weird cracking type noises. At first it was rare. But now it is more regular. Visitors/guests now actually make comments about it.Pros: + Beautiful look. + Thin. + Barely noticeable frame + good Colors, Brightness, and Contrast. + good amount of different types of ports. + Base is sturdy. + Clear Glass Base + Good / Comfortable remote. + Wide viewing angle + Good Delivery service. 2 guys brought it in, set it up, and took garbage, though it did take longer than it should have,Cons: - The sound is somewhat off. it echoes slightly and i cant figure out how to have it not do that. It also does not get very loud. - The Tv is listed as 240 HZ refresh but it does not offer anything close to that. - The input lag is decent but not as fast as it could be. It is slower than my last Tv but not horrible. i could not find actual values for this. - the ports are annoying and on the side rather than in the back. though this could be a benefit for some people i guess. - the Tv sits very close to the base. So if you have a center speaker sitting in front of TV, you may run into problems. - Very few choices for labeling each input type. - Heavy - TCL does not seem to have support on universal remotes. So no codes. - havent noticed the dynamic backlight - not a smart Tv.

Reviews.Title: Amazing picture!
Reviews.Author: William Ronald Bethea
Reviews.Content: Forget the fact that you have never heard of this brand...the picture and the build quality is truly outstanding.  After a bit of minor tweaking, I can easily say that this is the best picture I have ever seen on any television.

Reviews.Title: a year later and working like a champ
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Rice "RICER"
Reviews.Content: it's been over a year and (knock on wood) no problems whatsoever.  I don't know about the "smart tv" functions as we don't use those - we have an xbox 360 and recently an xbox one and we use all those features on that device.  I will say that like many other low-profile and slim tv's, it's physically impossible to have great speakers.  I would highly recommend getting a soundbar.  We keep our tv muted.

Reviews.Title: hdtv
Reviews.Author: Jeffery P. Payne
Reviews.Content: man this HDTV looks beautiful the colors are bright with deep contrast, not a smart TV. it says its 240 hz but I don't see any where on the menu where I can verify it. also can not find it anywhere on line, also the price was 500.00 dollars when I bought it. now the used ones cost 800.00 dollars ??  I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: Great quality and value
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant at buying such an inexpensive, non-name (in the USA) monitor but have to say it's been a great purchase so far.  Wish I'd gone bigger but, having grown-up in the era of 25" tube TV's, this is still enormous by those standards.Almost a full year of use so far and no complaints.  I use this with my Onkyo HET amplifier, but also use the built-in speakers at night to keep the volume lower.  Verizon FIOS DVR including remote control, XBOX 360, PS3, Wii all work fine.

Reviews.Title: great hd  55in-240hz television
Reviews.Author: jeff
Reviews.Content: great television for the money I paid last December. The hd  240 refresh rate format on sports is well worth the investment. There are only two things that  bother me. All of our other led TV's are on the table stands and we put this one on a wall mount, every time you turn it off the case makes a cracking noise for as long as it take to cool off. and the other thing was one reviewer was un happy with the sound which I agree with. if you add a sound bar or surround sound it will take care of that. When we made this purchase the price was 699. the same price as the 55 in - 120hz is now. outside of the poping cracking cool down and the sound I would have given it a five star rating.

Reviews.Title: Nice price and quality
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Chee
Reviews.Content: I bought it last December for my grandma, she watch TV about 10 hours per day, so far so good.

Reviews.Title: Best value for your money
Reviews.Author: Kashy
Reviews.Content: Best priced tv with a 240HZ processor you can buy. The only thing that can be improved on is the sound and speakers that are somewhat weak and tiny sounding.

Reviews.Title: Great TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Bull Built Differentials "Nils"
Reviews.Content: Just a good TV without all the extra gadgets. The first one showed up with a green area at the bottom of the screen, Amazon promptly sent a new unit and had the defective one picked up. Have had the TV almost a year now and no problems, love it.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Robert Brush
Reviews.Content: Have had this TV for a good while now and it works great.Pros: Works as advertised and is a great value for the money.Cons: NoneI was hesitant to buy this due to lack of brand recognition, but I am glad I did....yes I recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Loud, unacceptable cracking sounds
Reviews.Author: Nate
Reviews.Content: 55" hi def for $700...wow, I must be dreaming.  Worked great right out of the box.  Beautiful picture.  Great stuff but wait, what are those loud cracking sounds...like plastic cracking?  It even happens when the tv is turned off.  TCL says the cracking sounds are normal, the result of internal high temps.  WHAT?  Let's make sure we understand, all your tv products make this sound?  We were told it's possible.  At first they said they'd send new parts in 7-10 days to correct the problem (even tho they said it wasn't a problem), and then a tech would install them, but the next day they said "Never mind", no new parts, no repair.  We don't want a loud, cracking-because-it's-too-hot tv, so we asked to return the new, under warranty tv.  TCL doesn't accept returns.  Now it's clear why their prices are so low.Now it's up to Costco.  I'd be floored if we don't get satisfaction fr them because they fully understand it's about making customers happy.  Then we'll replace the TCL with a Samsung.  And as for future purchases of TCL products in this household, you've got to be kidding.  Their customer DISservice totally turned us off!

Reviews.Title: Might have just been a bad one?
Reviews.Author: D. Johnson "Dr. Duck"
Reviews.Content: So I watched the delivery company remove this from a truck full of all types of appliances, none of which were tied down.  I hooked up the tv, and turned it on, and it looked pretty good for the price, but not even close to Samsung.  Then I noticed two bright spots behind the screen, it looked like someone was shining a flashlight on the screen. It drove me crazy so it went back (amazon did a great job with the return).  I debated trying another TV due to all the previous good reviews hoping this was just defective model, but the way the TV was delivered the first time killed that thought.Do yourself a favor and spend a few more $ on a Samsung, the picture, quality, and company are better.  It will save you a headache from getting another TV and returning this!

Reviews.Title: Waiting for the axe to fall!
Reviews.Author: John Yuma
Reviews.Content: I purchased the TCL 55 from Amazon, Jan 2013. The Display is amazing,but were not sure how much longer it's going to last. After about a few months use, we have been experiencing 2 unusual problems. Problem 1 -  The unit, when on,  will emit a racking sound, as if somebody hit the case internally with a hammer. The first time it happened my wife thought it was going to fall off the wall. Fortunately it does not happen that often, maybe 2 or 3 times a week.Problem 2 - The sound on our unit is very acceptable for a Large flat screen, but intermittently (maybe once or twice in an hour) the volume will increase about 50% for a very brief time span (< 2 seconds), it can be annoying. I intend to solve that problem, by installing a sound bar.We have owned the set too long to get Amazon involved, and from the reviews of TCL customer support, we just don't need the headache. Our recommendation is to find a better quality brand, even if you have to spend more.

Reviews.Title: Bought it as a gift
Reviews.Author: TheTechGuy
Reviews.Content: This was a present for my parents anniversary. They use it daily for about all day. It has a great picture and the sound surprises me. I am one who typically uses outboard sound systems rather than internal speakers feeling them inadequate. To my surprise, the sound is great even for my hearing impaired parents and speech quality hits the mark.

Reviews.Title: awesome
Reviews.Author: Kelly Jean "KellyJean"
Reviews.Content: I totally love this TV! n Great picture, has an awesom EQ to set the sound on different settings.  It's great.

Reviews.Title: Love the Picture
Reviews.Author: Roman Schmitz
Reviews.Content: Had this tv for 5 months now.  Still love the picture the only thing I had to buy extra is a sound system, it could use a little more bass, a soundbar would be recomended with this tv otherwise excellent buy.

Reviews.Title: Went out after 1 week
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: But they replaced it and no issues since.  Good picture, could use a speaker bar. Good t v for the price

Reviews.Title: Can't really fault this one
Reviews.Author: daveB "daveb"
Reviews.Content: A great tv, excellent picture, like others i had never heard of them, but 2 yr warranty sealed the deal......

Reviews.Title: Low budget, high value
Reviews.Author: theWeasel0
Reviews.Content: Things i didnt need: wifi, apps, internet, 72 connectionsWhat i got: a great picture, good darks, bright light areas, just fine sound-nothing special but not crap either(eventually will be buying a soundbar), good 1080 support, no motion blur i can detect, and a pretty damn good energy star low cost device.Only complaint: one of the back light bars doesn't seem to know when to be on or off and rarely will turn off causing the brightness to drop a bit but it's rare(and is probably saving me money anyway :-p)

Reviews.Title: TCL TV
Reviews.Author: Ironcity
Reviews.Content: Love this TV.  I took a chance but read great reviews in China about this TV and how popular it was there.  I got this for $500 and now the TCL brand has gone up in price(as it should).  Great quality and picture.  Only thing that is not perfect is the remote is rather bland, but I don't use it as everything is hooked up with DTV anyways.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Don't think its 240Hz Though.
Reviews.Author: You mean she's NOT Irish?
Reviews.Content: I'm very impressed with this TV, I got it on a great sale and I'm very happy with it. I bought it to replace a 720p Insignia TV that I had, but now I have them both side by side and use them for different reasons. I am more inclined to use the TCL 1080p TV because the picture is clearly better. Nice crisp colors and makes playing video games more fun. The design is great and the bezel is nice as well.However, I do not believe that this TV is 240Hz. The information bar in the bottom right of the screen tells me that I'm watching "1080 x 60Hz".I'm not an expert in this matter, but thats what the TV is telling me, so I have to believe that it isn't 240Hz.Regardless of this matter; I got the TV cheap it works great and I'm happy.*****The HDMI ports / usb / etc. card came loose about 5 months into this TV's life. Contacting customer service got a new card/motherboard sent out to me, and a technician called to set up a repair date. The TV works like new again.***

Reviews.Title: Overall great tv
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I've had this tv for ~6 months, and I'm really happy with it.Pros:Very nice pictureAcceptable speakersGreat dealCons:I had some trouble assembling the base. There was a screw that wouldn't go in straight, so my tv doesn't sit quite flat. It does look like it would be really easy to wall mount if I were to try though.Overall I'm really happy with my purchase and I would definitely recommend it if you are looking for a no frills tv that is really good.

Reviews.Title: TV
Reviews.Author: kay o goff
Reviews.Content: I love my television.  It has worked great and I have had it for several months.  Picture is good and quality I am happy with.

Reviews.Title: GREAT
Reviews.Author: rocker8
Reviews.Content: THIS TV IS AMAZING. IT HAS THE BEST PICTURE I HAVE EVER SEEN ON ANY TV, EVEN COMPARED TO WELL KNOWN NAME BRANDS. IT ALSO HAS GREAT SOUND QUALITY. YOU WILL NOT BE DISAPPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: Great TV
Reviews.Author: Keith Jacobs
Reviews.Content: Watch it every day and am happy with it. Great TV. Great price too. I would suggest this item to anyone who wants a flat screen TV.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic condition
Reviews.Author: Tammy Hummel
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous buying a not new TV, but the savings really outweighed the risk here and I have a beautiful TV that works perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Too noisy
Reviews.Author: Doreen Rowell
Reviews.Content: The picture and sound on the tv is ok, considering the price.  But, I have to say that the noise the tv makes, whether it's off or on, is extremely annoying.  I believe it's caused by contraction and expansion of the tv but it happens ALL the time, whether the TV's on, off, morning and night.  My home is only about 1,000 sq ft so I can hear the noises made by this tv everywhere in my house, it's actually woke me up.  I've had many TV's over the past 40 something years and never had one this noisy, loud and/or annoying.

Reviews.Title: AWSOME TV
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: AWSOME TV , EVEN BETTER THAN EXPECTED , VERY HAPPY WITH IT AND WOULD DEFINATELY BUY ANYOTHER ONE IF I WAS LOOKING FOR ONE

Reviews.Title: THis TV is great for the price and is much better than expected.
Reviews.Author: Anthony F
Reviews.Content: The base is solid and durable so if you are not planning on mounting it on the wall this is great.  The picture is great and contrary to some other reviews we have not had any problems with the speakers being inadequate.  The TV is in a living room that is about 20 by 15 and we have never had to raise the volume over 25 with the kids playing in the same room.  The way our house faces it is sometimes in direct sunlight and the picture still looks great.The only drawbacks I found so far (we bought the tv about 4 months ago) are that there is no way to connect a soundbar to it, only a headphone jack and the remote uses a format that is not available on the Directv remote, so we bought a GE universal and programmed it (had to learn the codes from the TCL remote) and it works great.

Reviews.Title: great pic
Reviews.Author: John P.
Reviews.Content: It took a bit to get the proper setting, but the quality is very very good.it is a great product.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV, I love it!
Reviews.Author: Simpleton
Reviews.Content: This is a brilliant TV that provides high quality images.  Clear display, without any flash (you bet it, 240Hz).  No fancy functions like 3D, internet, bluetooth, but who care?  I can easily switch between cable, HDMI1, and HDMI2 as often as I need for my desktop, laptop, and even my camcorder.  (Yes, it has more inputting ports.)  No trouble to view it from a wide angle, from my dining room through my balcony.  I heard it was a good brand, but I didn't realize how good it was.  Now all I want to say would be: Buy it!

Reviews.Title: Nice tv for the price
Reviews.Author: Urban Legend
Reviews.Content: Its not a bad tv for the price. My only knocks on this tv would be one sometimes the HD doesn't look as good as HD I've seen on other TV's, but that could be because I never tuned the tv. As with just about every flat screen the speakers suck and my last one is when it's turned on it makes this plastic cracking/breaking sound, but once warmed up it doesn't do it anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: Steve666
Reviews.Content: Good, clear picture. The only thing missing is that I would like a couple more HDMI ports, two is just about two short of enough.

Reviews.Title: Only one thing could make this TV better.
Reviews.Author: Tayler G. Franklin "Tayler"
Reviews.Content: When I wrote the title I was thinking about one specific thing but now I just thought of another one. The big one for me is the cracking noise it makes on random occasions usually after its been on for a while, or if you turned it off recently. I have a feeling it will do this less and less the longer I own it, since I haven't heard it in a while, but to explain what I'm talking about, its kind of like when your car has just been turned off and you hear it making little pops and cracks as it slowly cools off. Well, this TV does that as well. Its extremely minor and its kind of just a nit-picking thing, but the first time it cracked(settled?) it actually did scare me a little. After a month of having it that happens a lot less often now though and everything else about it is awesome, so I would definitely still buy it again.The other thing that would be nice is if it swiveled. My last TV had a swivel stand that made it extremely easy to adjust if I was sitting in one corner of the room or if I was trying to look up a walkthrough on my computer while playing a video game. If this TV had that capability it would seriously be the best TV I have ever purchased and for a much better price than anything similar on the market.

Reviews.Title: Awsome deal!
Reviews.Author: Ty253
Reviews.Content: I got this at an awsome price for what it does! No bells and whistles like 3D or smart TV but the picture is perfectly clear and it has the outputs that you can use to stream all your devices! i. e. Xbox, Playstation, Wii, Apple TV, Blu-ray ect....strongly recommend this TV. 2 year Warranty is a big bonus too.

Reviews.Title: Best TV ever
Reviews.Author: James Weisner
Reviews.Content: Good price and high quality image. I recommend this TV to my friends and family. Wide viewing angle and deep blacks.

Reviews.Title: GREAT TV, GREAT SIZE
Reviews.Author: Steven
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better picture, and TV itself is very nice looking..love the narrow frame!  Responds well whether watching sports or movies.ONLY COMPLAINT:  Sound.  Would have given 5 stars if not for the speaker quality.  We had a Panasonic before, and the sound was great, but this one has pretty lousy sound (and I'm not very picky about things like that). We purchased a sound bar,  which provided little improvement.  From what I've read online only a complete sound system will truly improve the quality..so we are considering that.We bought this TV at a great price on Amazon, so really saved enough to cover a sound system, but still wish we didn't have to.Still, I would have to recommend this TV for the price.  We have really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly Surprised
Reviews.Author: M. Frost
Reviews.Content: When buying a tv I have always played it safe staying with Lg, Samsung or Panasonic, however, this time I figured I would take a chance and go by the Amazon reviews. Well I can tell you this tv is great. The colors are bright, crisp and vibrant. The sound is fine for a 48 in. Tv, however once my son hooked up external speakers the sound seems more like a movie theatre . With a 2 year warranty and a low price you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: Very nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: J. Rose "James Rose"
Reviews.Content: The TV is ultra thin with a really small bezel which make it fit into a space smaller than my old 42" LCD. I don't know understand or believe the 240HZ thing.....I have friends that have 120HZ tvs and you can notice it. I do not notice anything on this TV but as others have mentioned, it may be because I am mostly watching cable TV. I have cable and a Roku 3 hooked up and they both look awesome. I have this for 2 months so far with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Nice bang for the buck.
Reviews.Author: William Hedgepeth
Reviews.Content: Nice pic since the optics are produced by Samsung. The only problem I had was the DirecTV controller can't control it so I use two remotes.

Reviews.Title: It was a great deal at $494.00 in March 2013!
Reviews.Author: razorbackshelley
Reviews.Content: This TV is fantastic!  All of the reviews are spot on.  The sound needs a little help from a sound bar or surround sound system if you plan to use it blast sound, but overall this was a great deal when I bought it -- small note: - $494.00 on Amazon when I purchased mine in March.  It looks like all of the positive reviews have helped the value of this TV increase by $250.00.  Now that it is ranking up with Samsung and some of the other better known performers, I am not sure I would make the same buying decision.  Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Good Value
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: I have not experienced any of the problems reported by other reviewers.  The picture is entirely acceptable and the frameless design gave me room for a larger screen than other brands.  The price is a good value, but I do have one regret.  It does not facilitate ARC through the HDMI connection, so I had to use the antiquated stereo out sound, which of course negates any of the Hi-Def audio features of my digital inputs.  Seems like state-of-the-art would be state-of-the-art.

Reviews.Title: TCL 55" Better Than Many Others
Reviews.Author: Patrick
Reviews.Content: Before I bought the TCL 55, I looked around for months. I am not an expert but I know what looks good... I even bought and brought home a Hitachi - took it back as the picture was not good. This compares very well with higher priced TV's. Have not seen another TV, for picture quality, in the price range that can touch it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Thomas Shelton
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent TV for the money!Some reviewers say they have an issue with the sound, so the first time i hooked up my cable i adjusted the settings, and i can't complain.The only negative was on the delivery and setup.When the guy arrived he opened the back o the truck and pulled my tv to the bay. At this point i was expecting someone to come around the other side, as it clearly says on the box to use at least two people.Upon bringing it into my house he hit the ceiling fan with it, and after finally getting it unboxed, asked me for the tools to set it up!What is that? I paid for delivery AND setup.Needless to say, after having to show the PROFESSIONAL how to connect my tv to the stand, and watch him have to remove the screws and try again, he was finished.Upon inspecting it i noticed it wobbled. My 55' tv was wobbling from side to side when sitting on the ground. There was no way i was putting it on my tv stand 3 feet off the ground.He hadn't installed it correctly.I simply told him it was fine and he left, after which i went out and bought a new tv stand, and using the  mounting feature to mount the tv, as i could not get the base to securely attach.All in all the tv is perfect!Only downside was the setup.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Earl Levers
Reviews.Content: I give the Amazon company 5 stars! I bought the TCL 55” TV and there was a power loss on and off several times. The TV went off and when it stopped going on/off I turned the TV back on. To my surprise the image (The TCL logo) was upside down! Then when the picture came on it was upside down. Just to let you know I am a retired 30 year Audio/Video tech. That being said the picture(before the problem was EXCELLENT! Even the audio(knowing they are not large speakers) was good. I callthe service support of Amazon and they were very helpful, they rep was Elizabeth E, she was great, I explained  the problem and she got me to the TCL factory service rep. She was no help at all, she said she would go to the tech department. She called me later and said they would have to repair it, I was not told how long that would take. I called back to Amazon and Elizabeth said rather then have me waitshe would send new replacement in about a week. OK here comes  information that I had told the TCL service rep. Being a X video tech I know that these newer TV's can rotate the image to allow differentlocation such as you see in Walmart(TV turn side ways for store ads) This is what I told the TCL rep.She knew nothing about that. Well the delivery was set up for the replacement BUT a friend of minefrom the company I worked for happened to stop in and saw my problem, he made a quick call and got the factory service codes, he used them and got a menu that he was able to ROTATE it back to normal.All is well and TV is now fine. I called to cancel the replacement. I again must say that Amazon and the service rep. Elizabeth E. were great! That is what makes buying from Amazon #1= customer serviceEarl

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: streetover88 "dwayne"
Reviews.Content: I love the tv, however the stuff that Amazon put out, about how when it arrived the shipper was to bring it in, set it up, and all that other propoganda,  sure was not true.  They had one guy bring it in, did not even have a two wheeler or any kind of cart, so he kind of just bounced it down the sidewalk.  I have had open heart surgery, but I had to help him in with it, and he said he was not allowed to install it.

Reviews.Title: TCL 55' HDTV is a player!
Reviews.Author: Jerry L.
Reviews.Content: The HD picture on this 55" set is superb! I was a little leery of making a big purchase of a product manufactered by an electronics company I had never heard of .... TCL. But a little research revealed that it is a large player in the Chinese electronics market and is now entering the US market place as well as others. It was also comforting that the TV came with a 2-year warranty while the standard is just a year. The sound system is fine for me but audiophiles may want to enhance the existing 16 watt system. There are only two HDMI inputs, but again, fine for my needs but may be an issue for you. It's Energy Star compliant and will only cost about $20-25 a year to operate. This 55" beauty has a very thin bezel that makes it look 4 or 5 inches smaller than the 56" Panasonic it replaced. Set also comes with a classy black glass base. The freight company delivered on the promised date but showed up about three hours late (not bad compared to some of my other experiences!). The shipping carton showed some 'wear and tear' with some gouges in it but the TV was paced in lots of protective material so it was fine. The delivery folks took it out of the box and plugged it in ....... fired right up! I give this HDTV 5 stars at this point. Hard to beat 55" LED, 1080p, 240Hz with 2-year warranty delivered to your family room for $699.00!!!!! Hope this helps you in your search for your perfect HDTV.

Reviews.Title: Wow ....
Reviews.Author: Dave & Pam
Reviews.Content: This TV was received last week .. Delivery was great - He helped me set it up and verify everything is working before asking me to sign for it .. The shipping company also was going to take the box away which i decided to keep it .... This picture is AMAZING !! I watched a few blu rays with overscan off - AMAZING !! I replaced a panasonic 720p LCD projection that was 11 years old - This is definately a step up BY FAR !! Even if this thing only lasts for 5 years until OLED is affordable - I will be extremely happy !! No RCA outs for tv but i am using coax SPDIF and it sounds AWESOME. For $699 i believe this is one of the best purchases I have made in awhile .... I would definately reccomend ...

Reviews.Title: Great HDTV
Reviews.Author: Mystic
Reviews.Content: If you just want a no-frills HDTV this is the one, good screen and good sound. Add you smart bluray or PC and your good to go.

Reviews.Title: Best 55" 1080p 2D display out there for the price, Highly recomended
Reviews.Author: E. Mautz
Reviews.Content: I use this HDTV as the display for my Home Theater system, so I use it more like a computer monitor that a true TV.  However, the colors are great, there were no dead pixels, it is nice and sharp and picture is great (no ghosting or anything else weird).  Also, Amazon's white glove delivery was great too.  They took it out of the box, installed the stand and test the unit.  My previous units was attached via DVI so I ran an HDMI cable and ... nothing.  The guys helped troubleshoot by looking at the TV settings and making suggestions on my end.  Luckily I had a spare HDMI cable and that one worked just fine.  They packed up their stuff, asked if I wanted them to take the packing material, and I was set.  I've had a couple movie nights at the house and everyone thinks the display looks great.  I couldn't be happier with it (ok, I could be happier, but TCL would need to make a 60" or 65" version of the display).

Reviews.Title: Great Product for amazing price
Reviews.Author: DomBee
Reviews.Content: Was skeptic about this product since it was so cheap for such a nice TV. I have had it for 3 months now and it is an amazing TV. I have had no problems with to so far.

Reviews.Title: Huge improvement over our old Sony Bravia LCD 52-inch TV
Reviews.Author: A. Cheffy "Cheffy"
Reviews.Content: We just received this television today [05-08-2013]. This has a great picture with the setting at the 1080i setting on our Comcast HD cable tv box. I upped the color intensity and a few other tweaks but otherwise love how it looks.The sound isn't too shabby to us (not any quality loss compared to our 5-year old Sony Bravia LED hdtv).The nice folks who delivered this called to set up an appointment for the delivery, so, be sure Amazon.com has your current phone number before you order this item. The delivery service was great. Two very nice men brought the TV in, carefully unpacked it and screwed the stand to the television and connected our hd cable box to the set to check that it was working properly. We opted out of having them take the box away in case we have a problem within the initial 30 days (but, they will take all of the box and packing material away if you would prefer).We did opt to order the 4-year extended warranty.P.S. RCA brand TV remote codes will work for this Television if programming a Universal Remote or other remote.

Reviews.Title: Ok TV poor service
Reviews.Author: NANCY cox
Reviews.Content: Tv Died after 2 months and it took 5 weeks for the company to get it repaired. first I had to wait 2 weeks for them to send me the parts  then another 3 weeks for them to get a repair man out to fix it.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price.
Reviews.Author: MyPerspective
Reviews.Content: This is a great TV, especially for the price.  The picture is sharp and the colors are robust.  I've been using it with an Android UG802 (which is powered by the TV's USB port) and an Apple TV.  Both have worked flawlessly with this TV.So why did i deduct a star?  For one, the sound on the tv is mediocre.  It's not a huge deal since many homes have a home theater setup, but I don't so I rely on the TV's speakers.  Secondly, the TV likes to moan, creak and make noises when you turn it off and on.  It's not a big deal, but it's a bit disconcerting when you hear it for the first time.  I have the TV mounted on the wall and every time i hear the TV creak, I think the TV is going to come crashing down because the wall mount is giving way.  Again, it's not a deal breaker but it's definitely annoying.

Reviews.Title: I've had it about a week now
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Works great and looks great.  I owned a smaller TCL before and decided to try a bigger one.It's a real sharp looking tv.  On the other hand, putting it together is a little more difficult than other tvs.  Make sure to either get the logistics guys to put it together (carefully) or make sure to have an extra set of hands to help you out.  55 inches can be difficult to handle alone

Reviews.Title: its okay
Reviews.Author: NUSA
Reviews.Content: Now i read the reviews over and over cause this was my first big screen and i wanted it to be perfect. Price was right and I was happy when i first got to use it. but honestly this tv lacks controls fine tuning and customize options. After owning it for 4 months theirs grey patch's all over the screen when the back ground is black like when its first turned on. also i been told that the tv loses hdmi signal every now and then so theres no picture only sound, i have only one hdmi running to the tv everything else is connected to my Yamaha receiver. i haven't experience this issue might be operator error or could be the reviver not sure i haven't seen the problem myself. I really hope this tv lasts longer than 2 yrs so i can save up for a samsung cause i dont think i want another tlc or vizio cause the bigger vizio 60in have worse issues with bad parts going bad.

Reviews.Title: Great TV.
Reviews.Author: Rachel
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant to purchase an off brand TV. BUT this TV was worth it. We have been using it for 4 months and had absolutely no problems. We get a lot of people that say "WOW" about the TV, it is really nice. excellent presentation of Movies and TV. Sound is a little low, but we hooked up a surround system and its perfect. Would recommend to anyone, and thinking about getting another for another room.

Reviews.Title: Nice TV
Reviews.Author: annette
Reviews.Content: This HDTV is great in picture, color, and sound, I never heard of the brand before I tried it for the price and it turn out to be the best choice I made.

Reviews.Title: A good buy for the price thus far
Reviews.Author: jamaica1
Reviews.Content: i have used this tv in several different ways and here are my ratings:HDMI Connection with ps3: The graphics and sound is really good using the HDMi connection for gaming i rate it at (4), didn't give a 5 because the picture quality isn't that much better than that of a 32" panasonic 720 60hz tv i used previously.HDMI Connection via Dell laptop: I must say i am impressed, shows vibrant and vivid colours once the quality of the interface your using is high quality..try watching cold play's Paradise in hd and the picture quality is mind blowing (4.5).Analog or digital cable connection: the stations with quality picture shows nicely however some stations show poorly, which i think solely have to do with the quality from the cable company, think my 32" panasonic handles the cable input better than this tv (3)in general im really impressed, sound quality is good, picture quality is mind blowing at times, however there are dark patches all over the screen which are clearly visible especially when the start up display is shown, you don't notice it when tv is on and running though, ohh and the unit itself looks very stylish and neat, had some problems screwing up the stand for the tv and the remote is crap, you have to point it directly at the sensorpros and cons:Overall Picture quality (4.5)Sound (3.5)General Performance (4)Price v Quality (5)Remote (2)appearance (4.5)

Reviews.Title: Worth it
Reviews.Author: L. Leahy
Reviews.Content: So far, this product has been awesome. We were a little weary of ordering online and from a brand we never heard of, but we are very impressed. Beautiful picture and wonderful quality!

Reviews.Title: Great Basic Tv
Reviews.Author: J. Martin
Reviews.Content: I was satisfied enough with this basic tv, I went out and got another for the bed room.  It has a great picture, but is much more enjoyable after hooking up a sound system.  Either way, I now have confidence in the TCL brand.

Reviews.Title: Great TV Great Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: There's not much I can say that hasn't already been said.  Quick delivery,  phenomenal picture.  Sound is a little tinny, but easily remedied.  Adjusting the default settings does help.

Reviews.Title: We Love It ...
Reviews.Author: Tellenut "Z"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this television to replace a beloved 36" Sony Trinitron Wega XBR with such a great picture we had no incentive to move to HD.  When the eleven year old Sony started to show signs of failure, we chose this 55" as a replacement.  We primarily watch sports on this unit:  golf, tennis, basketball and baseball.  Stunning picture quality!  Using the picture adjustment settings can improve an out-of-the-box great picture.  We adjusted the sound using the equalizer and it is very listenable.  We will add a soundbar in the future.The delivery team from CEVA was excellent.  Nice guys who hauled the big box in and offered to set it up and test it.  We live in Colorado and the temperatures were cold so we declined as we wanted to give the unit time to warm to room temperature.  We are comfortable with assembly and connectivity of electronics.  Everything about the assembly went smoothly, plugged it in and it performed perfectly!  We are connected with DirectTV Genie DVR HDTV service.The television does have a mysterious momentary creaking and cracking sorta' like a good ole dog settling onto his cushion.  It adds personality and intrigue as again, it is momentary.  It probably has something to do with the warming of the set.  Does not bother us.We consider this an unbelievable bargain as it exceeds the picture seen on most comparable sets.  Everyone who has watched it in our home agrees.

Reviews.Title: Great TV, Great price
Reviews.Author: David Sigler
Reviews.Content: I bought this 55" TV for Christmas so I have been using it about 4 months now. Was very easy to setup, awesome picture, I do not use the sounds from the TV as I use my surround sound system for that. I paired this with a Logitech universal remote and the whole system works like a charm. I did a little research before I bought and this TV came out on top. It does not have all the fancy stuff of some of the TV's but I get all of that fancy stuff through my Blu-Ray player so I didn't need it. At half the price of the other TV's and with the 240hz you cant go wrong. LOVE IT!!

Reviews.Title: a great tv beautiful picture i love this set
Reviews.Author: William Judson Jr.
Reviews.Content: what a great buy 699 for a 55inch 240  its beautiful the i could ask for more an at this price its is a gift if want a big tv an can not afford that 2000 price tag  this is the buy for u  I LOVE THIS TV

Reviews.Title: Great TV at the price I bought
Reviews.Author: Wild Bill
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV recently based on the low price. It is now over $200 more than I paid less than 2 months ago. I had previously bought a TCL 24"  LED TV for occasional use based only on the low price. I am very satisfied with it. My old CRT TV was acting up so I decided to get a replacement. I did not do any showrooming, only shopped online using Amazon (especially the reviews) and the manufacturers' sites. This shopping and my good experience with the small set combined with a low price made my decision for me.  At first I was somewhat disappointed in the picture quality - I am on DirectTV. Then, after adding a Blu-ray player I found that it was my non-HD DirectTV that was responsible. Adding a Blu-ray player gave a spectacular picture. Keep in mind I am going from CRT to 1080p LED and did not compare actual pictures of competing models.It takes a little adjusting to get colors just right and it does not have all the features of some sets. It has more than I can figure out so it meets my needs.I strongly recommend this TV if the current price is attractive against well-known competitors. I ordered it in the afternoon and it arrived around noon the following day! Great service.

Reviews.Title: TCL is amazing
Reviews.Author: M. Blackburn
Reviews.Content: I own both the 39" and the 55" TCL TVs. If you are looking for just a good quality panel, no smart features, etc. Then this TV is a great buy. TCL has a contract with Samsung, and I believe that nearly all their TVs use Samsung panels. You do have to  adjust the settings a bit, as the default "ECO" setting doesn't do the display justice.I use mine connected to my PC, and it works well for that too. It actually has pretty good input latency for a TV.After owning two TCL panels, its the only TV I recommend.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted...
Reviews.Author: Joanne L.
Reviews.Content: I was skeptical about ordering an off-brand TV, but for what this TV offered, the price could not be beaten.  I read the reviews on Amazon and I read the reviews on other sites, I checked out other comparable TV's and in the end, I went with the TCL.  When the TV came, it was exactly as described.  The set-up was very simple and the picture was great.  The only issue I have with it is the Auto Volume Control which is supposed to keep the sound consistent.  The Control kicks in right after the sound goes up so it is not subtle at all...in fact it is more distracting than not using the Auto Volume Control at all.  Since this is such a minor problem and it was not the reason I purchased the TV, I still gave the TV a perfect rating.  I have had it for a few weeks now and I am still just as happy with it as when I received it.  I would highly recommend this TV because the value of it is excellent for the price you pay.

Reviews.Title: great TV and exceptional tech assist
Reviews.Author: oheo "kacey"
Reviews.Content: We love this TV. The picture is sharp and no glare or problems with the windows in our home. We had trouble setting up our sound system and today's tech assistant, James, was FANTASTIC!!! He was patient, skilled and very professional during a long trouble shooting phone session. Thank-you Amazon for great products and fantastic tech support!!!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: Brendan Doyle
Reviews.Content: This TV has a great picture after a little fine tuning. The audio quality is good enough if you play with the equalizer, but I have a home theater so it doesn't bother me at all. I use this TV primarily for gaming and it is very good for that.

Reviews.Title: good TV
Reviews.Author: kodiak
Reviews.Content: The TV has a great picture hooked up to satellite HD.  The sound fades in and out no matter what you are watching, I tried to contact TCL several times and do not get a call back or an email, I want to ask them if there is some type of adjustment I may have missed so it will sound better? No response! It is a shame too because the picture on this TV is awesome.

Reviews.Title: Picture is brilliant!
Reviews.Author: TT
Reviews.Content: Very good picture.I was apprehensive about buying this as I am not familiar with the brand.I find that the TV is very nice.I don't see any lack of quality... actually, I think it's better than most of the major brand name TV's.The picture is brilliant.It doesn't have the "smart" features, but I already have a Google TV box, so didn't need it.If you want a brilliant picture on the cheap, this is it!

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Ferrell
Reviews.Content: I am okay with the TV.  I thought the 240Hz would make a difference, but I can't tell.  Actually the picture is not as rich and clear as the smaller Samsung I replaced.  Also, DirectTV does not have a code for the remote, so now I have use two remotes to control it.  I emailed questions to TCL but have never received a response.  Would I buy it if I had it to do over?  Probably, just because of the price.

Reviews.Title: Good TV, great oversized monitor for my computing.
Reviews.Author: Tripster2001
Reviews.Content: I got this for my computing needs and it works great.  I can speak to any tv/cable/satellite as I don't have it hooked up to that.  However, I do have watch movies from it and I have been very happy with it.

Reviews.Title: TV's not bad, but customer service Sucks (update)
Reviews.Author: Robert Mitchell
Reviews.Content: ****Update:  Long story short, I finally gave up on the Warranty company who was handling the repair issues and reached out to the TCL through their facebook page.  I got an immediate reply telling me that an executive from the company would contact me the next day.The guy called me and was very responsive to my complaints.  He apologized and immediately got in touch with the warranty company (A&D; electronics - who I still can't say enough bad things about!) and my problem was immediately resolved.TCL genuinely seemed to be as outraged as I was, so I'm raising my review to 3 stars.  The TV deserves more, but I can't let them completely off the hook for their vendors actions. *******I bought this tv for my mother in law to put in her room and while the tv itself has a lot of features and came with a good price, it stopped working a couple of weeks after we bought it.I did the trouble shooting as listed in the manual to no avail.  I called in for service and the lady on the phone seemed confused and wanted a bunch of information that wasn't on the Amazon receipt.  She also insisted on the serial number, which is located on the back of the tv, so I had to remove it from the wall in order to get it (though I had all of the information other information from the Amazon receipt.  They they made me print, scan and email the receipt and THEN call back to arrange service.At this point, they said that they were going to send out a part and that when I got it, I was to call them back to schedule the technician to come out.  When the part never showed up, I called them back and the lady said that the part had never been sent.  So, they ordered the part again and told me that it would be here in two days....it showed up a week later!I then called them back (again) and they told me that a technician would call me in a few days....at this point, I was getting pissed, but remained calm and asked if they might be able to expedite the matter since we had been waiting since March 20th when I first called them.  They told me that they would see what they could do.Today, I got a call from the tech and he can't get out here until later in the week...that would mean that IF he can fix the tv that my mother in law will have had this tv for about 6 weeks or so and that it will have been broken 3 of them.I called AGAIN and the lady said that if they put in a new work order that I will go back to the back of the line.  The supervisor told me that there wasn't anything that she could do.  I asked if she could call the repair company and at least see if there was a different tech who might be able to make it out sooner and she told me, "no, I won't do that".I located a different number for the TCL and have been on hold for the time it took me to write this review (about 20 minutes).....So, I'm seriously regretting this purchase and considering simply returning the tv at this point.  I don't know if that is what I'll do, but if I was thinking about buying this tv again, I'd go with a different brand.  That's my 2 cents worth...

Reviews.Title: best tv i ever owned!!!!
Reviews.Author: Robert Christian
Reviews.Content: my friends laughed at me when I told them I bought a 55 inch lcd tv online but this has been the best deal I got on amazon, and now I see this is now almost 900 bucks, I only paid 699 with free shipping, glad I didn't get the black Friday deal I was looking for this was a much better deal, now im waiting for the 70 inch to be 699 with free shipping, lol

Reviews.Title: A Solid Television for the Price
Reviews.Author: Anthony Fisch
Reviews.Content: I do not usually take much time in writing reviews on Amazon, but felt compelled to share my experience this time. This product is absolutely fantastic! For the price point it delivers above average value and a cleaner image than I was expecting. The scrolling text if you are watching a news or sports program can be slightly fuzzy around the edges, however the overall picture is fantastic.Word to the Wise: Please do not be fooled into believing what Amazon tells you about delivery timetables. I picked the 9-12 slot, and spent seven additional hours waiting in my apartment buildings lobby for the delivery to show up.

Reviews.Title: Using this TV as I write this review...
Reviews.Author: EMorales
Reviews.Content: It was more difficult than I thought to find a TV with no wireless, Smart TV, etc. I don't need any quasi-computer features on my TV when i am plugging it into an actual computer(to my videocard, to be specific). HD looks as good as any legit HD you've ever seen on blurays, digital cable, etc. My only gripe would be the lack of another HDMI in. Personally, I'm fine with it because I use one for my desktop and one for my cable box. Others might want more.

Reviews.Title: Unexpected Gem
Reviews.Author: Thomas E. Bright "Fixxit1st"
Reviews.Content: This tv is competetive with the big name brands in a big way, considering the cost. Was completely blown away by the picture quality, and at 240hz, it is especially sweet when used for gaming. Highly recomended purchase.

Reviews.Title: Execllent TV for the price
Reviews.Author: Macesman
Reviews.Content: After checking out many LED TV I found this one to be the best for your money if don't need a smart TV.  I even shop at Costco usually it is the cheapest.  Found out this online LED to be the cheapest with good spec. 240 Hz.  The picture look nice and very sharp.  Can't beat the price for LED TV 55" and pay only $700.  Also they use a company that willing to delivery Sat. which is great I don't have to take a day off and wait around.

Reviews.Title: Great deal
Reviews.Author: landscaper
Reviews.Content: Great everything, so far I am very satisfied with the display, the controls and the color quality. I spend 2 days to the price and also got free shipping.

Reviews.Title: Excellent TV
Reviews.Author: Skridd
Reviews.Content: Researched a lot of TVs and decided to get the TCL 48" for under $500. I had it for about 3 months now and it is probably the best TV I have every purchased and I have a Samsung 60" in my living room. I wish I would have known about TCL before I purchased my Samsung. The one minor thing is that it is not compatible with my cable remote or my blue ray remote so I have 3 remotes, but for the price and the picture, it is well worth it. I am looking now to buy a smaller TCL for my daughters room.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding!
Reviews.Author: Angela S. Maggi
Reviews.Content: This tv exceeded my expectations ten fold! It has awesome picture and sound. It is absolutely the best tv for your money!

Reviews.Title: It's a 'Blessing!
Reviews.Author: D.E.
Reviews.Content: "THE CREATIVE LIFE"Great TV, all the way around.  Picture, sound, & all the features on this set is awesome.  As I've compared other name brands in terms of price, 1080p, 240Hz, plus it's a LEDTV w/ a 2-Year Limited Warranty.  Pound for Pound, this is the better product on the market that I've found.  I am very happy with my purchase, again, "Great TV!"DE; Philadelphia, PA

Reviews.Title: would rate it as high as any I,ve seen, excellent picture,,sound,and responce. to remote.
Reviews.Author: William L. Broome
Reviews.Content: I,ve researched all I could find and this TCL brand is just as good as any of the others.Hands down.

Reviews.Title: amazing
Reviews.Author: kyra armstrong
Reviews.Content: the panel is lim and makes your tv seem so much bigger ,tv quality is a 8 out of 10 and sound is amazing overall this is a pretty good tv for the price

Reviews.Title: I am very happy with this 55" TCL TV!
Reviews.Author: J. Rease
Reviews.Content: I am giving this review on the TV I received just over a week ago. It is a replacement of the same TCL TV I received a week previously that upon delivery and powering it on we saw it had a defective picture, and I refused delivery. I was disappointed that it was probably internal damage from shipping. I called Amazon right away and they had a replacement shipped out that same day. The replacement was in my city within 48 hours, though the local delivery company couldn't schedule it to deliver over the weekend. But it was at my house one week after the first TV was refused. Good job, Amazon, on the fast replacement service!This one looked excellent right out of the box. It was easy to assemble the base and connect to my AT&T; U-Verse receiver and my Sony PS3. I already knew I would connect my older Sony stereo surround system to it and I had already bought a coax cable to connect to the headphone jack on the back. I use that for mostly movies. Personally, I think the TV speakers are fine for normal TV shows.The quality of the picture on this is excellent. It is as good as any I have seen on bigger name brand TVs in stores. And I am amazed at how good Blu-ray movies look on it! I did customize the color settings according to other reviews I read here and adjusted to my own preferences.I researched and bought this TV based on price and the reviews I read here.
